Reviews.Title: “Excellent representation of Homewood”
Reviews.Author: Commguy101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Homewood suites in various locations, and this one is a very nice offering for hotels in the area. Check-in was smooth and friendly, as was the case with any interactions with desk staff and other employees. The room was clean and fresh. A maintenance request for a leaky toilet was responded to quickly (not so much a nuisance to me but hated for them to be losing water down the drain!) Breakfast and dinners were hot and tasty. There is a spa next door in the Hilton Garden Inn. Landscaping was beautiful around the property, and I even found someone mopping the sidewalk one morning as I was leaving. It did seem very clean in all areas of the property, and was in a location that felt extremely safe. Despite other reviews, I had no problem with connecting to wireless at this location. All in all, a good stay for the week of business I had. Easy to get to from the interstate, and there was a Vons nearby for groceries, etc. Nothing really around if you're on foot ... you'll need a car. Thanks, Homewood!

Reviews.Title: “You won't regret staying here!”
Reviews.Author: Wendy B
Reviews.Content: After extensive research, my husband, toddler and I stayed here for 4 days during our first visit to San Diego. I cannot rave enough about our stay. The staff people were so friendly and helpful and especially kind to my daughter. The breakfast and welcome home reception were great, and we enjoyed both immensely. Conveniently located to pretty much everything, the hotel was clean and modern. Our suite was perfectly laid out for our needs since the kiddo slept on the sleeper sofa in the living room, and we could close the bedroom door to keep from disturbing her. You can't beat the price for all these amenities and added personal touches. Thanks, Homewood, for a most excellent stay! We loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bobalucchi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a few hotels in the area and Homewood is a very good family style hotel. The hotel is warm, the staff is friendly and rooms are a little small but are laid out nicely. For the price, this is an excellent hotel to stay in.

Reviews.Title: “No Surprises”
Reviews.Author: Jim K
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very clean, quiet and friendly staff. The dinner we had was excellent, as good as any resturant, and free beer!!! Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Sea World, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in all ways!”
Reviews.Author: BostonNancy
Reviews.Content: What a gem of a hotel! It is almost like a B&B. The staff is so friendly, the breakfast and dinner service almost like home, with a kitchen and delicious food of various types - something for everyone. The rooms are quiet and large, beds very comfortable, kitchenette, bath and living room nice! Pretty pool, hot tub and outside area. Small but good workout room. It is well located but a car is needed as it is about a10 minute drive to the beaches of Del Mar and La Jolla, 25 to downtown San Diego, 5 minutes to grocery store. Great quiet neighborhood to walk or run in. We will always look for Homewood Suites from now on!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice 4 1/2 stars”
Reviews.Author: Shurik
Reviews.Content: The personnel are very well trained, apparently. Very much customer service oriented: quick, responsive, proactive in trying to help the customers. Very nice and spacious suite; we had a King with a sofa sleeper 1-bedroom. Very clean. Breakfast and evening reception were very nice. They were making hamburgers and hot dogs and bringing them into the reception area, as they were ready. Good quality, not the small cheap dogs that you sometimes get. Definitely great value. Location is not the best, if you visit San Diego, since you have to drive for about 13 miles to downtown. We didn't have any problems with the traffic, and even found a free parking space in the Gas Lamp District. Would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great value”
Reviews.Author: abc_sea
Reviews.Content: Great base to see legoland, zoo, seaworld. Breakfast and a light dinner is included. Pool is small but good for small kids. Staff is very friendly. Overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Back again, and will be back again!”
Reviews.Author: aswessen
Reviews.Content: Simply my favorite hotel in the area. Next door’s Hilton Garden Inn, which offers a decent dinner and it is just across the Homewood Suites parking lot (they share). The breakfast at Homewood is substantial, the coffee decent and the rooms are spotless. Love the beds. Plenty of pillows. Staff friendly, efficient and personable. Not my first stay here nor my last. I came here with my teenage daughter and hubby on a college road trip, but have stayed here for business too. I get free wifi with Hilton Honors. Within minutes of major San Diego attractions and San Diego State University, but not “too close” if that makes sense. So free parking, not overloaded with people. My preference, may not be yours.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: Traveling_Smiths
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 5 nights on vacation and we were happy with the hotel overall. We had a king suite. Our room was clean and comfortable. The only odd thing was the layout with the bathroom door - if you opened the door from the toilet/shower area it nearly touched the sink outside - open carefully if you think someone might be brushing his teeth or plan to apologize for clobbering him with the door. The crew at breakfast did a great job of keeping things cleaned and stocked though a little more variety for fresh fruit might have been nice. There were grapefruit and apples everyday. A couple days there were oranges and bananas. There were also make-your-own waffles, scrambled eggs, another hot selection that varied (sausage, potatoes, biscuits/gravy), oatmeal, yogurt, cereal, muffins, bread/bagels. The noise level in the hotel was mixed. It was far enough from the highway that we didn't hear road noise, but we faced the courtyard with the pool so heard the revelers in the hot tub until they closed it down at 10 PM. The hallway doors were nice and tight, but the walls still pass quite a bit of sound - babies crying, people on the phone. One morning they started doing some very loud work in the hallway outside our room at 10 AM, one way to make sure we got out and about after a late night I guess. The location worked well for us since we visited Legoland north in Carlsbad and spent time south in San Diego. The free internet in our room worked well, but wi-fi for the iPod would have been nice without having to go down to the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Back again- great service, good rooms, quick check-in and out”
Reviews.Author: RXD
Reviews.Content: Good experience coming back a second time. Nice room, very comfortable. Front desk staff do a great job. Only strange thing is that when I left (at 3 AM) there was no one at the desk. I did get the receipt by e-mail the same day but still...

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a large family to relax!”
Reviews.Author: Dana123_12
Reviews.Content: Spring Break in San Diego to visit the zoo and Sea World. Enjoyed the hotel's extra space (2 bedroom suite) and great hot breakfast. Everything very clean and even though we were on the 4th floor (smoking areas, yuck!) The smell was not in our room, however, I would have appreciated being asked if why minded or were at least told that we were in the smoking section but did not find out until I asked why there smell of smoke in hallways. Anyway, staff very friendly and great service.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service and Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kevin R
Reviews.Content: Had a great time in San Diego and this hotel was the best. Nothing was too much bother for the staff. Many thanks for a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “The BESTof the BEST of everything, staff, rooms, service”
Reviews.Author: Julie R
Reviews.Content: My mother and I had a little leak in a pipe on Labor Day, 2011 that damaged the hardwood floors and forced us to vacate for almost 2 months. We wanted to be close enough to home to keep an eye on the progress of the repairs and also be comfortable, and to me, that means being able to cook our meals. I am a local internet marketing consultant so I am all about checking reviews online before I make a decision about where to buy, eat, stay, etc. This particular had great reviews so we booked 2 suites. From the very first time we walked in, stressed, upset, and my mother almost in tears, we felt like we were home. All of the staff are so kind and generous, going out of their way to make sure guests have everything they could possibly need. There were a few who stuck out though, and in the best way possible. Stephanie made my mother feel sol much better, just by being attentive, chatting with her, getting to know her. She always asked how things were going at the house and made my mother really feel hat she cared about her welfare. The chaos of the demolition in her house was extremely stressful for her and being able to come back to Homewood Suites after being amidst the debris and the construction was like a balm to her. She was able to head upstairs after chatting with Stephanie or one of the other front desk staff and unwind for awhile before I brought dinner to her. I am a night owl and got to know the staff who worked the afternoon and night shifts a bit better. Monica was, during the time we stayed, worked in the evenings and many times I would wander down and chat. because most of my work is dependent on having a good internet connection, when there were occasional issues, she bent over backward to find a solution, whether it was calling any one of the wonderful maintenance staff to trouble shoot, or running next door to find a cable I needed. These folks are so efficient, thoughtful and frankly, creative in the way they take care of their guests. I have traveled a great deal in my time on the planet, as has my mother and we have both stayed in so many hotels, neither of us could even begin to count them. Out of all of them, we both agree this is the absolute best experience we have ever had . From the physical space, the rooms, the actual kitchen...really...with a stove,a dishwasher and a real refrigerator where I could actually cook, and did, every day, to the housekeepers, the maintenance guys, all of the front desk staff, especially Stephanie during the day, Monica in the evening (though she works during the day now) and Dan,my favorite night desk man, these people take pride of place and service to heart. All of them, every last one of them, made what was a very unpleasant experience for my mother and me and turned it into a rather fun little adventure...one where we actually made friends and felt truly cared for. They wear many, many hats, wear them extremely well and are at home in all of them. We are grateful we found them...and I have decided that the next time I need a vacation from my mother, I am running to my other home in Del Mar. Shhhhhh...don't tell her!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay, great staff, kind of isolated.”
Reviews.Author: clloydm
Reviews.Content: Extended stay doing work in the San Diego area. From check in to check out the staff was superb. They have a really average breakfast buffet but the staff make sure that you have everything you need. They have a "welcome home" buffet from Monday through Thursday that is very good and can serve as a meal. The local restaurants are basically limited to the buffet and the Garden Inn restaurant next door so be ready to drive if you need anything else. I had two complaints during this stay; the Air Conditioning went out in my original room and there were two mornings where there was no hot water. I was there 2+weeks so this was minor really. Each was noted and my room was changed to one across the hall so the move was painless but the view changed from the pool to the parking lot. I have stayed here several times and will again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hilton/Hotel in the USA”
Reviews.Author: Pip H
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot for work; about 1 week a month. I only stay at Hilton's for their great rewards program; so I know Hilton pretty well. The Homewood Suites in Del Mar, CA is by far the best overall hotel. The staff is so great, you'd think they were all part owners (and i have never wanted to take the time to get on this site and write a review before). Last year i got sick, the front desk offered to bring me meals as well as a free VCR with a library of movies. This year, a boiler had gone out, so I had no hot water when I woke up. i went to the front desk who were very sincere and offered me a shower in their spa; which i planned on using during lunch. Only by lunch time, the boiler was back up to full speed. The manager asked if I needed anything else. I did need a haircut, so she booked me one. When i went in for the cut, they said i would get 50% off. Well the hair cut, shampoo and style was probably the best ever (when I got home, my wife said, "finally! a great haircut'). After the cut, I paid the 50% i owed and left the rest for a tip; about $20. When i returned to my room later that night, there was an envelope with a note from the manager saying, "Sir, sorry for the misunderstanding. Your service for today was compt. Please see attached". When I turned the letter over, there was my $20!!! This hotel truly cares more about their guest than making an extra buck. I'm so impressed; I’m bringing my whole family.

Reviews.Title: “Love this Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: mamason
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here a few times before and it is still a great place. Nice clean hotel. Not too much to eat in the surrounding area though. The pool was closed for renovation while we were there, however the hotel emailed me about this in advance. You were allowed to use the pool at the Hilton Garden Inn next door but we did not take advantage of this. The nightly meal was good and breakfast was also good. There is ample seating in the breakfast area. I will return to this hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Routine Homewood experience, NO WIFI”
Reviews.Author: fooddr
Reviews.Content: We live in the area, and were having new flooring put into our home, and stayed here for 4 nights. It is the typical Homewood experience, nice rooms, average breakfast--coffee wasn't drinkable two mornings (may have been the leftovers from the night shift, as we were early) light meal in the evening was OK, deli sandwich and soup dinner was OK--definitely Campbell's chicken noodle and tomato soup, and once we had our sandwiches eaten they began to bring out the salad, and chips---we think they might need a little help in the kitchen. (We'd heard they cater from the HGI next door but I'm not so sure) If you have business in the area, it's a good base to stay, but the lack of WIFI in the rooms seems positively 19th century.

Reviews.Title: “Clean-But loud construction on pool and NO wifi.”
Reviews.Author: CeliacTraveler57
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very clean and well maintained except for some of the furniture in the lobby needing cleaning. We have a quiet room that's a King 1 bedroom. The kitchen is super clean. I have Celiac Disease and felt the need to clean it only to rid it of any hidden gluten, but the cupboards and counters where spotless. We're here for three weeks, so I may have an update. My husband is traveling for business and I'm tagging along for fun. The only real issues are: 1. The pool is being renovated and so a jackhammer has been loud all day and the pool won't be available for 1 1/2 weeks (till March 16, 2012). It would have been nice to know about this before we had booked for three weeks. We didn't find out till the day before the construction started. 2. No WiFi. Really? Yep. The building seems to have been built in 2007 and yet no wifi in the rooms. It is in the lobby. Because there is a Hilton Garden Inn next door that sometimes I can pick that up, but it's iffy. I find this unacceptable given the newness of this hotel and the prevalence of business travelers who need WiFi. There is wired internet, but it's a short cord for using at the desk only for one user at a time. Otherwise, we'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly, comfortable”
Reviews.Author: GonzoZap
Reviews.Content: Stayed on a business trip to San Diego area. The front desk staff was very friendly. The breakfast selection was good. The room was clean and comfortable. My room faced the pool area. There were some loud people there in the early evening, but they ceared out by 9:30. If the stayed longer, the noise would have been an issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, nice meals and clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: GiorReg
Reviews.Content: My two children and I stayed there for a couple of nights in February 2012. We arrived late but the staff were very helpful on the phone and when we arrived. Breakfast was good and varied each day we were there. We tried the free dinner one night and were pleasantly surprised at the free wine and beers and the quantity of food available. A bit further from San Diego than I realised but easy access to motorways.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend/ Farmers Open”
Reviews.Author: Ann G
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel, the staff was so helpful and courteous and went out of their way to help us , our room was really very spacious and very very clean, The complimentary breakfast was excellent. I will definitely be returning to this hotel when next in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, great experience!”
Reviews.Author: TravelMommyOfSix
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with six kids for a "college tour" of southern CA. We stayed several days at this property and really enjoyed our time here. It is located in business park setting, but is very close to the freeway. We had a two-bedroom suite and it was very accomodating for our crew. Morning buffett was good. Service was great. Do not think twice about booking here!

Reviews.Title: “unbelievable value”
Reviews.Author: wandererplus4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this property jan 2011 and it represented incredible value, not only were the rooms spacious and so clean and tidy, but the complimentary beakfast was sooo good and would you believe they also gave a complimentary dinner on certain weekdays, not only did you get a meal with salad but free beer and wine, now that is value. We stayed at Homewood as it was a great starting point to get to Leggoland, the Safari Park and Seaworld as well as going into San Diego itself to the Zoo and Gaslamp district. Being out of San Diego itself was wonderful because it made my Australian driver husband a lot less stressed with the traffic. We used a tom tom to get around and ate at Dennys a couple of nights as food was fantastic and 5 min away as were a lot of eating places. The service at Homewood was truly exceptional and they had a laundry so we could get on top of our washing, we loved it so much we stayed and extra day because we really did not want to leave. So if you doing the theme parks and such and want a great base with theme parks only 20 min away and parking next to your rooms and loads of space in yours rooms this is the place for you. I really dont think you could get better value. Our family of 2 adults, 2 teenagers and a 10yr old absolutely loved it..

Reviews.Title: “We Will Return”
Reviews.Author: longball44
Reviews.Content: We stayed here six days in November to spend time with family and friends and have Thanksgiving. Andrew, the manager, gave us a nice King Suite at a fair price. The breakfast menu changed daily and was one of the best we've tasted. The spacious room was clean and comfortable. The hotel staff could not have been better. They clean the rooms daily which is semi-rare on extended stays now days. Thanks for your time.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Nina R
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over the holidays with our kids and grandkids. Did not expect the free dinners and beer and wine that were included during the week. Very tasty and plentiful. We were appreciative that we did not have to venture out to a restaurant with a 2 year old after a long day at Legoland or the Zoo. Very kid friendly, helpful staff, clean, all the amenities you could want. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: sarameyer
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 6 nights. Great customer service by all staff. Good location for all attractions. Within 20 minutes of Seaworld and Zoo. Rooms are clean and property is well maintained. Would highly recommend this hotel. Sara M

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: ganeshram i
Reviews.Content: Had an excellent stay, great warm (though standard) breakfast. Great customer service. Room was on first floor, right next to the exit and was the only bad point, but didn't bother us.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the best”
Reviews.Author: joohyunish
Reviews.Content: I have been there for 7 days for holiday seasons. I have booked 1 queen studio but found an issue that bathroom door was broken, then switch the room. However, I also noticed that heating system did not work. So, I requested a room- upgrade to the front guy, Dan. He was one of the best front persons I have ever met. He offered me a King bedroom suite, but it was smoking room. Then, I also asked to Ann, general manager to switch the non-smoking room, and she offered me two queen bedroom suite. It was amazing. Everyone working in this hotel is very friendly and helpful during the stay. They are always customer’s side. They also have free parking, free internet, free breakfast with meats and free dinner with red and white wines and beer during weekdays (5-7PM). This hotel is way better than 5 star hotels I have ever been regarding overall services, price and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my stay”
Reviews.Author: jojo1492
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights over Labor Day weekend. The room was clean and comfortable and the staff was helpful and professional. The person who handled my check in remembered my name the entire stay which was a nice touch. This is a nice hotel in a quiet location. The location is very convenient to the freeway. The only drawback is there isn't much to do within walking distance since the hotel is located in an office park setting. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Vey comfortable stay, let down by lack of restaurants/bars in vicinity”
Reviews.Author: southlondonerSE27
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights & were impressed by the comfort & facilities in the room (studio suite) including: 2 ring hob, sink, microwave, full size fridge, coffee maker- all in a spacious room with dining area & large shower. There was free internet access in the room, but via USB (one only)- seemed OK, but not particularly fast. I think there was wifi only in the communal spaces. The queen sized bed was extremely comfortable & standard of cleanliness was good.Staff were always courteous & friendly & willing to assist with any queries. A request for more towels via room service was dealt with quickly & efficiently. There is pool & fitness area but we did not try them. The breakfast was also very reasonable: choice of hot & cold (typically variations of scrambled eggs, sometimes sausages/bacon, along with potatoes/hash browns). Plus toast (white & brown), cereals, juices, selection of teas, coffee, muffins, porridge, yoghurt, fresh grapefruit, tinned fruits & a waffle maker. The free evening meal is only on offer from Monday-Thursday so we missed out on this as we stayed friday- monday. Our issue with this hotel is the location-it is a long way from any restaurants, bars, shops etc. It is very close to the I-5 which makes it convenient for San Diego's big time attractions but not so good if after a hard days sightseeing you just want to pop out to a local haunt for a meal or just to relax as this involved a major drive. There is the sister Hilton Hotel on the same site & we had a meal there one night, which was pleasant, but very quiet. The food was good & the waiter attentive & knowledgeable about the beers & wines available.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, but a little small”
Reviews.Author: AZDesertRoseAK
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and well maintained. It does appear to be an older hotel and there were minor updates and fixes that could be made, but overall it was clean. Our family of four stayed in a King Suite, and as other reviews I've read mention, the room was a bit small. However we like the division of space and the kitchen area for meals. There was just enough room in the "living room" area to pull out the sleeper sofa. The kitchen is small, but adequate. We did have to ask for an extra pot and silverware, but housekeeping brought them up within 5-10 minutes.This suite is better suited for a single traveller or couple. The breakfast was better than most and offered a good selection. They had the "continental bkfst standards" plus waffles and a different main course option each day. Day 1 was 2 different types of scrambled eggs, tater tot hashbrowns and turkey sausage; day 2 was scrambled eggs and biscuits and gravy. Unfortunately, we didn't take advantage of the pool/ spa area or the fitness room. The location of the hotel is great. We spent one day in San Deigo and one day in the La Jolla/ Del Mar area. It was close enough to head back for lunches and naps. It is also close to several restaurants (if you don't have any dietary restrictions), grocery stores and Starbucks ;) We will definitely stay here again, but next time in a larger room!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and excellent customer service.”
Reviews.Author: RajNYC
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for 2 days in November 2011, very clean,excellent customer service,free breakfast and very beautiful area.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel stay!!”
Reviews.Author: dasixers
Reviews.Content: Booked a package deal through Hilton, (Air, Car and Hotel) beat all online competition by 100 bucks. All I can say is that this was an absolutely wonderful stay. My wife, I and my mother in law stayed her for over a week for our son's graduation from USMC boot camp. Glad I picked this over several choices in the hotel circle area. Room are clean, staff is outstanding and you cannot beat the free breakfast and Welcome Dinner on Monday's thru Thursday nights. Saved tons of money by not having to eat breakfast and Dinner on the outside. I had such a great trip that I took the time to write an email to the Hilton Corporate office to thank them for the wonderful stay!!! Facility is kept spotless at all times, and the staff were absolutely great and service was well above what was expected. If I go to San Diego again, will definitely stay here as opposed to closer to downtown SD..

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....location ok for business...not so much for recreation”
Reviews.Author: fistful_of_dollars
Reviews.Content: Clean....new....upgraded..big suites...great breakfast...what else do you need. Can be a little pricey sometimes...but love this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Average rooms and poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: Pathfinder889
Reviews.Content: The rooms are smaller than the other Homewoods that I have stayed in. The front desk staff need additional training. They do not make the guests feel welcome and could not care less if you did not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff”
Reviews.Author: CdelP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few weeks, on-and-off and got to know the staff. They are great and very helpful. The hotel itself can use some updating but the rooms are clean and the beds are comfortable. They serve breakfast and a manager's welcome in the evening so it is a good deal especially for families. They also have a kitchen. As a matter of fact, I recommended it to friends of mine who visited San Diego this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, nice value”
Reviews.Author: vdesigner
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights recently and found it to be a very nice place to stay and we felt the price was great for what we got. My husband, daughter and I were in San Diego to take in the Zoo, Sea World and to do some general sightseeing. We had a Studio Suite which was big enough for the 3 of us, our daughter slept on the sofa bed and while we did not have the privacy a one-bedroom would offer it was fine for such a short visit. The staff was very kind and helpful, the free morning breakfast was good, rooms were clean, as were the grounds and rest of the facility although the pool could have been warmer. Even though it is in Del Mar we found the drive to all the attractions to be fairly quick and enjoyable. We would stay here again no doubt!

Reviews.Title: “Great place at a great place”
Reviews.Author: KillaSeal
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with the family when we went to SD to see the zoo. the property itself is very clean and well maintained. The suite was very nice, we had two queen beds in the bedroom, and the living room had a sofa bed as well. I also noticed that the bedroom was very spacious, with plenty of room to lay our luggage out with tripping over the suitcases. The kitchenette was very nice, with a refrigerator, stove, and microwave, as well as dishware and silverware. My children had the breakfast buffet the next morning, which I thought was very good for a small hotel (scrambled eggs, hash browns, sausage, and you can make fresh waffles on their wafflemaker!) We didn't use the pool area, but it was very nice and clean, with space heaters by the tables, and even a grill that you could use, if you were planning on being there for a while. Overall, I really liked this hotel, and prepaying in advance (that's what I did) gives you an even better deal!

Reviews.Title: “Average not Excellent”
Reviews.Author: CRZYJPR
Reviews.Content: My fiancé, son and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend while I was out in Arizona for work. We got in just as dinner was ending on the first night and found that the location of the hotel did not have a great deal around it to choose from or stock up. The front desk clerk only offered up information for 2 pizza places in the area that delivered. The location of the hotel was convenient to the 5 which was good for the rest of the stay. We drove up to Legoland one day and down to San Diego Zoo and Balboa Park the next with no issues. The location was also very convenient to the Scripps Aquarium in La Jolla. The rooms were average to slightly dated. There was unfortunately no wireless Internet available in them so we tethered to our cell phone. Beds were comfortable and air conditioning worked well. There was a full size fridge which worked out well when we finally found a Walmart and Target a few exits down on the 5. Breakfast was nightmare and the most stressful part of our day. This place seemed to be the hang out for EVERY family vacationing in the area. The breakfast area was cramped with little seating available inside and out. Just as we were leaving on our second morning they decided to open up one of the conference rooms for additional seating. All in all, it was an average Homewood with a location that was convenient to the highway and not much else.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service!”
Reviews.Author: Carlycanine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while traveling for work. I was amazed by how pleasant and accommodating the staff is, especially the late night person, Dan. I had spoken, casually, about a destination I always meant to see in SAN, but never had. The next morning, there were directions to the location under my door. Very nice and thoughtful. Everything else about this location is pretty comparable to other homewood suites, but the service gives it the edge!

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it should have been. But ok.”
Reviews.Author: Jacmo
Reviews.Content: We are HHonors Gold Members. We favor Homewood and Embassy's for the room when we travel with family. This was our big trip of the summer. The 2nd half was at this Homewood. The location is ok. We needed to be in between San Diego and Carlsbad so it worked for that. It wasn't real convenient to San Diego. There is nothing near by except a Hilton Garden Inn. The spa and restaurant they described on the Homewood website is really next door. The room and hotel were an average HS. What we weren't excited about several things. 1st time ever a homewood charged us to 'upgrade' to a room with two beds (we had three people). We were there on rewards and at this hotel, that isn't good enough for two beds. I've stayed at many, many HS's and never had this happen. Parking is extremely limited. Come home early! No wifi in the rooms. Only one wired connection. We run ecommerce businesses and we travel with two to three laptops, phones that would benefit from wifi and other stuff. Ridiculous in this day and age that you have to go to the lobby for a Wifi connection. The breakfast closed early at 2 out of the 3 days we tried to make it. the 3rd had very little selection available and wasn't quickly replenished (3 breakfast burritos and the family in front took all of those). The evening reception we never saw open. I'm sure it must have been, but again, not for the posted hours. Again, we love HS but this one did not do it for us.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Family or Business”
Reviews.Author: RCabeza
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a long weekend with the family as a combined work/vacation trip. Overall, this is an excellent choice for a family hotel--and you can get some work done. Misses: Pool area is very small and can get crowded with a lot of kids (including mine). The (free) breakfast is limited and rather bland (e.g., watery industrial scrambled eggs). No wifi in the rooms--only a single wired connection. We had 4 wifi-using devices, but could only connect one. Hits: The staff were, without exception, very responsive, helpful, and friendly. Examples: I asked a desk clerk how long it would take to drive to another city. After she had already given me a general estimate and I left, she printed out a list of directions to the specific location I mentioned and brought it to me outside the building where I was unloading my car. Maintenance responded very quickly to a couple of minor complaints (broken lamps)--at 9:00 at night. The hotel sent the complimentary shuttle to pick me up at a car rental location and brought me back to the hotel quickly. The breakfast is free, and they have waffles, which my kids liked. There are a couple of hot options. Kid-friendly movies were always playing in the "overflow" room during the meals. The evening reception is really a free dinner with wine and beer. Yee-haw! Our suite with the separate room and kitchen with full-size fridge was fantastic for a family. With kids, the second TV and door between rooms is incredibly valuable. Plenty of space. There's a desk and task chair to get some work done. The location is perfect if you are looking for many different activities. It's 5-10 minutes from La Jolla and even closer to other beaches and Del Mar racetrack. You are roughly equidistant from San Diego, Legoland, and the Animal Park in Escondido. Plenty of food choices within a mile or so, in addition to the on-site choices. Plenty of parking. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Was as expected!”
Reviews.Author: DeputyDan
Reviews.Content: This location was what one would expect from a Homewood Suites. Some observations: 1) The dinner food was better than expected - esp, the bbq night. 2) The king bed suites are much small than expected - I recommend getting a room with two queen beds. They are much more spacious. 3) The breakfast had alot of selections and was served at 6:30 am - however the food was just ordinary. 4) The blue collar employees seemed to work harder and cared more about guests than the white collar employees. I was somewhat suprised at the lack of general knowledge of the area and the operations of the hotel displayed by the folks working behind the check in counter. When I asked one employee a question about how the van service worked - she said that she couldn't work and think at the same time and I would have to wait until she finished what she was doing to be able to answer my queston. I also told her that the location I needed a van ride to was 4.8 miles away according to mapquest and she said they couldn't help me because the van didn't deliver anyone to a location over five miles away. Guess she was a product of the public school system ;-) I would stay there again but I wouldn't expect much help from the staff. 5) The mattress in my room needed turned - there was a definite sag.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and good location, but small suites and slow service”
Reviews.Author: Jason_Tinley_Park
Reviews.Content: Pros: Great location Very clean hotel and rooms Quiet Excellent food (breakfast and dinner) Cons: Service was slow at times Rooms are small compared to other suites (we had the one bedroom suite) Pool and pool area is small and fills up with people quickly

Reviews.Title: “Love hanging with the Homeboys...”
Reviews.Author: Voondawg
Reviews.Content: I jokingly call this the Homeboy Suites b/c we normally stay at much nicer resorts when the wife and I travel but for the family, this was right up our alley. This is the second time coming to the Del Mar Homewood Suites, and though the rates were a lot higher than normal for this time, I understand supply/demand given the high reviews for the hotel and that this was the 4th of July weekend here. Most of the people that normally stay here are businesspeople I believe who have work in the nearby Del Mar/La Jolla/Carmel Valley area, but there are a large amount of families too I think given the value proposition. Service first of all is pretty great. I would think that the people here are all from the MIdwest in terms of the attitude [friendly] but they are also very motivated to help [eager]. That's a great thing. Negatives here are that they don't have bellboy service, so if you want someone to help with your luggage then this is not for you. They didn't have dual double beds so we ended up with a King for our stay of the family of 4 [kids are 6 and almost 4], and that was a little struggle. Sleep quality would be higher if we had double beds I think. They have free wired internet, but who does wired in the iPad/iPhone era? WiFi would be really nice in the rooms. The pool is also small, so when it's crowded it's not as fun and there aren't many chairs. The pool towels are also basically the golf towels with the blue or green line down the center and with a rough feel, so if your tushy needs to be babied instead of just dried, then don't expect Frette quality or anything near that there. Other than that, the sheets are fine [it's San Diego, so no need for down comforters], and the shower is decent. I'd love to have a double sink basin, but no need of course. The kitchen is great, and the topper are the complementary breakfast buffets [with waffles for the kids, though there's almost always a line] and happy hours [meals during the week] with beer and wine. My waist didn't thank me, but my stomach did.... The kids also got balloons and different little rubber duckies at breakfast one day which was a great touch, as well as opening up their Del Mar Ballroom when there was an overflow at breakfast. They played some kid movies on the TV in there, which made for a long but entertaining breakfast for the kids. Overall, it's a great stay, and usually great value. As it was, it was darn good. And the kids ranked the hotel above the Zoo behind #1- Legoland, #2- Seaworld [I think overrated, especially for the 3rd time in a year], #3- Beach [La Jolla Shores/Coronado], #4- The hotel and pool, #5- San Diego Zoo [sad... but when you wait in line for 45 minutes to see a panda for 2 minutes, that's what you get]. I think it's a #3 behind the Beach and Legoland which isn't bad...

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a Great Place to Stay! We WILL Return!”
Reviews.Author: luvlifeandtravel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our recent vacation to San Diego. I have nothing bad to say about this place! Check-in was friendly and fast, the room was super clean upon arrival with a nice letter from the managers just in case we had problems. The housekeepers did a wonderful job of keeping our room spotless and our kids loved how they would line up their stuffed animals on the bed--such a nice touch! When we return to SD we will keep this place in mind! The pool water was warm and the hot tub was nice and hot. The breakfast was plentiful with lots of selections--eggs, bacon, bagels, toast, cereal, hot oatmeal already prepared, lowfat yogurt with fruit and granola, waffle machines, great coffee and great juice! The location is in a very safe area. My son and I even went jogging straight out of the hotel--there are sidewalks everywhere! NOTE: One night we tried to go to bed early because we'd all gotten up around 4:30 am. Our room faced the pool area and it does get pretty loud depending on how many kids there are playing. No problem on regular nights, as the pool closes at 10 pm. But if you have young ones getting to bed before 10 pm you might want to request a room on the opposite side of the hallway to avoid the possibility of noise.

Reviews.Title: “Ok hotel, service good, rooms kind of small”
Reviews.Author: twinmom8
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after attending a SD Padres game. We've stayed at other Homewood Suites and I was very surprised that this hotel had an unusually small room. The bed was a king and the end tables encroached onto the bed, the room was more suited for a queen. The furniture in living room was knicked up a little. Overall service was good, breakfast always excellent, pool was warm, and never ending tea & coffee in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlreyna111
Reviews.Content: I do not have anything bad to say about this hotel. From the moment we checked in, we had nothing but great experiences here. We rented the 2 bedroom king suite which was very roomy and spacious. Very clean and comfortable. The sheets and towels were very soft and not scratchy like some other low budget places. We stayed here for a family vacation and went to the zoo, Legoland and Disneyland. All were not a far drive at all. While visiting Legoland we stopped at the Carlsbad outlet mall and did some shopping. The kids (8, 4 and 2 yrs) all loved the pool at the hotel and never wanted to leave. The water was a little too cool for me and my husband, but the kids didn't seem to mind at all. It was nice to have a full kitchen although we never really had to use it. The breakfasts were wonderful. We were there 5 days and never had the same thing over and over for breakfast. Eggs were not the usual powder eggs you get from hotels. We did partake in the dinners Monday thru Wednesday and they were quite delicious too. For the food being free, you would think it would be tasteless or boring, but not the case here. They all did a wonderful job. We would definitely return to this hotel if we come back to the San Diego area. We felt like the hotel was our home away from home while we were there. We did have free internet in our room. Also loved that we could rent movies that were very new that haven't come out to video. You can watch them for 24 hours from any tv in the room. I'm sure I'm forgetting something, but all in all this place is definitely worth every penny! Oh, I guess if I had to say anything that I wish would have been different, I would have to say I wish the alarm clocks would have a "white noise" function so that it wasn't so quiet in the bedrooms at night.

Reviews.Title: “Good place for your family trip to San Diego attractions.”
Reviews.Author: Haaliki
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (kids 4 yo and 6 mo) stayed here for a recent trip to Sea World. The hotel is close to the freeway to make trips to attractions easy. We made the mistake of trying to go to Sea World on the same day as the San Diego Rock-n-Roll Marathon, however, that turned a 15 minute trip into an 90 minute trip. Check-in was easy. We had a double queen suite, that was a good size and generally clean, but not spotless. The in-room refrigerator is more than large enough for a few days of food. The kitchen included plates and utensils. Call housekeeping for dishsoap and a cleaning sponge. They also brought us a crib for our little one. You can stock the fridge with food from the grocery store that's only a couple minutes away, by car. The breakfast is great. The gratis dinner is NOT served on the weekend. There was supposed to be free wi-fi in the common areas, only; but even there we were never able to get on the network. The front desk personnel were unable to help us with that. They just directed us to the business center. While the computers there are functional, they could probably use some updating. I specifically recall at least one sticky mouse that made navigating the Internet frustratingly inefficient. I think you can pay for a plug in or wi-fi in your room.There were a few eateries near the grocery store, but most of them closed by 9pm. The jacuzzi had a less than clean appearance, we were told, due to age and nothing else. It would fill with foam when the jets were running. The pool is small, and unless you get there when towels are first stocked in the morning, you may have to bring your own from the room. I understand that they may be improving the pool and jacuzzi. Parking was free and ample, but not covered. All things considered, I would go back to this hotel with my family, but not for a couples getaway or any special occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ejudge
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed here with our 2 kids. I thought it was excellent. The pool was a little small but was fine. What's nice was the free breakfast. We used it everyday before we went out for the day. Kids had plenty of choices and the coffee was very good I thought. They had a free basic dinner at night but we did not make used of it. We had a suite with 2 queens. Internet worked fine. Some of it was a little dinged up but the room was very clean. One thing I wish the room had was a safe. I had no place to keep my laptop. Anyway, Del Mar was very nice and appeared safe so maybe I had nothing to worry about. Hotel was 10-15 minutes from San Diego. Overall I would recommend this place. Free parking too.

Reviews.Title: “Home, not hotel-like atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelerjpn
Reviews.Content: During a 4-day family reunion in the area, the Homewood Suites Del Mar was our home base and very well worth every penny. PROS: Located just off of Interstate 5, the Homewood Suites is easily accessible from all points on a compass. Despite its close proximity to the highway, there is little to no traffic noise - being situated on a hill certainly helps. Torrey Pines State Park & Beach are within a 5-7 minute drive. For the active-types, you'll certainly get your running in with the surrounding hills and spacious bike lanes which will take you right to Torrey Pines, or should you crave a little more inland trail running action, Los Penasquitos Inland Preserve resides just to the east. There are beach supplies available for rent (beach chairs, umbrella, boogie board) individually or as a package deal ($30) which is convenient for beach-goers that packed light. There are multiple grocery stores (Vons) and restaurants within driving distance or utilize the handy shuttle provided by Homewood Suites. There is plenty of room in a King-size suite to stock up the fridge and freezer. The room itself was very well kept and housekeeping maintained strong attention to detail by restocking the room with fresh towels each day. Kitchen supplies are abundant all the way down to the mini-cutting board. Our room overlooked the courtyard in which a small pool and hot tub were situated among tropical plants. We also checked out their evening reception as the schedule was posted on the fridge. Their daily offerings vary from enchiladas, teriyaki chicken, and of course the BBQ Thursday nights. While outside dining options throughout San Diego are delicious, the evening reception is convenient and satisfying as it is accompanied by a full and fresh salad bar. The wine offerings left much to be desired. It would be nice to see some offerings from local vineyards (i.e. Temecula). Breakfast showcased the strength of Homewood Suites with real eggs (not that powdery, dry stuff), sausage, bacon, potatoes, fresh fruit (not day-old), and waffles. CONS: It was tough to find one, however, travelers should note that wireless internet access is available only on the first floor rooms. Only hardwired, ethernet connections are available on the other floors. This may be problematic for some - not all. There is a spa at the nearby Hilton Garden Inn which we did not take advantage of, however, while comparing prices to the spa just down the road, the prices at the hotel spa were relatively high for treatments. Homewood Suites Del Mar left no stone unturned and delivers a viable option to all types of travelers from business to recreational - the best value and location to enjoy all that San Diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ottawa1546
Reviews.Content: My family spent 4 nights at the Homewood Duites over March Break. The staff was terrific. The hotel clean and well appointed. The breakfast and dining area were well staffed so it was a great start to our day. I just wish they had free wireless in the rooms. Highly recommended and I would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel, Clean, Rooms a little dated”
Reviews.Author: gdspaulding
Reviews.Content: Overall, the hotel is a nice hotel. Rooms are just a tad dated (old style TVs and full bedspreads), and, we could hear noise from other rooms. Complimentary dinner and breakfast were good, a bit more than most hotels. Room was clean, nice selection of soap/shampoo/lotion. Pool was warm enough, but, early June in San Diego is cool, so there weren't too many people outside in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Room and service”
Reviews.Author: jimmytlin
Reviews.Content: The staff was friendly and helpful. Excellent room and family atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Great if you want a kitchen, free breakfast, free internet and free parking.”
Reviews.Author: finiky2
Reviews.Content: Hotel has easy access from I-5. My room had some issues - Clock didn't work and person in next room suffered from sleep apnea. I have never heard anything like that. I was awakened by the snoring both nights. I ended up getting a little rest on the living room sofa. Hotel was pretty quiet otherwise. Exercise room was very small. One of the treadmills didn't work. Rooms don't have sinks inside bathroom. I find that to be a big turn off. Hotel provides complimentary internet and hot breakfast and some afternoon dinner. I only had a yogurt and did not take advantage of the dinner with free beer and wine. Parking was free. Young lady at front desk just said, "sorry to hear that" to my complaints. She also could not provide any directions.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay!”
Reviews.Author: dtmbf50
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel & would highly recommend. The location was perfect for us - 20 minutes to the airport, 15 minutes to Sea World, 25 minutes to Safari Park. Close enough to all the major attractions without having to pay $30 for parking. Staff was superb - very helpful, friendly & accomodating. They have a free breakfast that is actually quite good & a lite meal Monday - Thursday. Both were heavily attended so obviously they were very popular. They also have a small area where you can purchase snacks should you get the munchies. We had a king bed suite which had a kitchenette area with a refrig, 2 burner cooktop, dishwasher & microwave. The sitting room had a desk, sofa you could stretch out on & an easy chair. The only complaint I had here is that the desk chair doesn't go up very high in relation to the desk height. Free internet access was a biggie for me plus they had a business center should you need to print out anything. The suite had 2 flat screen TV's. The bathroom set up was a bit different - the toilet & shower were behind a door but the sink was open to the bedroom - I get why they did that but it can be a bit of a pain if one is asleep & the other is up & about. But that is so minor compared to all we found that was right with this place. You do have to drive to get anyplace, it felt as if the hoeld was in a tech area but we had a car & access to I5 & 805 was a breeze. La Jolla was right around the corner as was Del Mar. Parking was ample easy. They had a small fitness center with a recumbant bike, 2 treadmills, an elliptical and set of weights. Hot tub was clean & enjoyed after a long day at the parks. And I have to reiterate, the staff was awesome. We will absolutely stay here again if our travels take us back to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Best San Diego Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: FashionLover87
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in San Diego over the years and the Homewood Suites San Diego-Del Mar was the best hotel I've ever stayed in! My spouse and I stayed overnight in the One-Bedroom King Suite and it was not only spacious, but also extremely quiet. The breakfast in the morning was delicious. They had make-yourself waffles, muffins, two types of eggs, toast, bagels, various cereals, coffee, juice, and so much more! I will definitely return to this hotel for my future stays in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Excellent Value”
Reviews.Author: travelnut2011
Reviews.Content: My family and myself just recently stayed at this fantastic hotel. It's immaculately kept, the food offered for breakfast and dinner is is wonderful. The dinners include wine and beer. This perk definitely makes its convenient for families after a day at the parks. I stayed in the king suites since I was travelling with my 2 small children. It was conveniently located close to Sea World and Legoland. The only downfall is the internet is extremely slow. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “excellent value”
Reviews.Author: david77melb
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 days on our trip to US recently. This place was the first stop. We got confused with the similar sounding name in San Diego and ended up driving to that one ( which has an excellent location and is rightfully better rated than this hotel). First of all you need a car to stay at this hotel due to the location which is a few minutes drive from S Diego. The service and the food beats all the cons for this place. The dinner we had ( only managed to get for the first day on a thursday) which was BBQ dinner was excellent. It included free wine ( both red and white) and light beer. The meat was excellent quality. The Bfast was excellent also for the price you pay for this place. Its close to I5 highway which helps. I would stay again. Very helpful staff ( front reception and dining staff). David.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent bang for your buck!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so pleased with our stay at this hotel. The breakfast buffet and complimentary welcome meals were very good. They had waffles, eggs, potatoes, cereal, oatmeal, and of course all the breads that go with a yummy breakfast. Also, the rooms were very clean. We liked the king suite so that our kids stayed in the living room and we had our own room. It is a surprisingly kid friendly hotel, with a good-sized pool and jacuzzi. The location is about 15 minutes from Sea World. We drive to Old Town and dropped out car off and took the trolley onto downtown. There is free parking there And the kids loved riding the trolley. Service is great at this hotel and it feels very secure and safe, and its quiet.

Reviews.Title: “HOME-LIKE COMFORT -- for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: WWMITER
Reviews.Content: Recommend this hotel? Yes Overall -- very nice and clean. Large suite, with kitchen (stocked) and living room, 2 tv's, free wireless internet, coffeemaker, free parking, free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service”
Reviews.Author: Kachow
Reviews.Content: I stayed for a week at this hotel with my family, including 3 young children, in their 2 bedroom suite and was entirely pleased with the service throughout. Every single employee was genuinely helpful, friendly, and eager to provide outstanding service. The room was clean and neat, the breakfast buffet terrific, and the welcome home dinners a nice perk! I also attended a conference for part of the time downtown in San Diego and the staff drove me each morning to the train station (5 mins away). Staff also made excellent recommendations for sightseeing for the family. also, the beds were super comfortable and the location was very close to Lego Land!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have asked for better”
Reviews.Author: sbrekus
Reviews.Content: Im taking time out from my 3 small children to tell everyone how happy and impressed we were with this hotel. We stayed here 6 nights while visiting the Zoo, Sea World, Legoland, etc. The hotel was very clean, new, and the staff could not have been nicer. The FREE buffet breakfast every morning was perfect, huge selection to eat from, waffle maker, eggs, bacon,biscuits and more. Then in the evening from 5-7 is a FREE dinner- yes free....with wine! This worked out super, bc after being at an amusement park all day we were all tired and hungry. It was great to go back to the hotel after a long day and enjoy a meal as a family and then all get in the hot tub and relax before bed. Our hotel room had a large room with the king bed in it and full bath, then another separate living room with a desk, kitchen(very convienient for left overs and any groceries), and fold out couch and TV for the kids to sleep on and watch cartoons when they wake up. We would stay here again in a heartbeat!!!!! Perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - Great Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: delmarsurf
Reviews.Content: This was a really great find – close to everything, but out of the city. You usually don't have a great meal at this type of hotel – but dinner here was really good. Get the steak with blue-cheese – you will not be sorry!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: JohnInAllen
Reviews.Content: If you have kids under 15 years old, this is the place to stay. It is super clean, the staff is very friendly, the free happy hours and breakfasts free you from paying for those meals. For the price and location, which is right about at the halfway point between Legoland, Sea World and the Zoo, you would be hard pressed to find a better spot. We rented a full size car, spent a whole week there, and did not even use a full tank of gas. Plus, it is situated in a very upscale, new neighborhood, and the main commerical neighbors are high-tech companies and law firms. This part of SD makes you think the entire city is landscaped and manicured. Makes me want to move there if it wasn't so expensive! We plan on returning to SD in two years and this will be the place we will stay!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice facilty, awesome staff.”
Reviews.Author: KimH76
Reviews.Content: Had to stay farther from my work location (downtown San Diego) than I wanted but glad that I did. The facility was very nice, breakfast and dinner offerings saved time on finding dining when I had a long work day. Housekeeping great, everything was spotless. The staff was awesome, friendly, helpful - that really makes the difference for me, makes traveling for work so much more pleasant. Will make it my loging choice for San DIego from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Love it!”
Reviews.Author: Hombresg33
Reviews.Content: The Homewood Suites was absolutely amazing. We stayed for 2 nights and had a great time. The room is great with a very comfortable bed. The location is great if you don't want to be in the center of things, and want to have room to enjoy your trip. Plus you can't beat the breakfast. The only hiccup I had during my stay was when I asked for more toiletries, the housekeeping lady looked at me funny and left them on the door. But other than that, it's one of the best hotels I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Campchefalo
Reviews.Content: This is the place to stay! From the time we called with a last minute reservation until we left every staff member was awesome! We got to the hotel around 6 pm and were told they were having a complimentary taco bar including beer and wine, something they offer every Monday through Thursday! The room was spotless, I may never stay in another hotel type again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel For Me and My Family”
Reviews.Author: improvgal
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in a lot of hotels.... this one really impressed me. It was really clean. The staff was incredibly friendly. It came with a full breakfast and dinner. It had free parking and internet, a kitchenette, easy access to the highway, a 24 hour store with reasonable prices for things you forgot or an ice cream treat... I could go on and on! It was so easy to stay here with our small kids because the reasonable prices meant we could have a suite instead of just one room. We liked it so much we extended our stay. I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: DraxNJ
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel was superb. The rooms were a bit small, however, the staff made every accommodation to help us fit a pull out and roll away in a one room suite. Really appreciated the full breakfast, laundry facility, and location to many attractions, not to mention the great price. They also provide complementary dinner Monday - Thursday! Would highly recommend this hotel for families traveling to the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for family”
Reviews.Author: raytango
Reviews.Content: This hotel surprised me with the cleanliness, excellent service and low price. The free breakfast and dinner/happy hour buffets are a nice plus. I recommend this place 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Worth The Money, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jinnaa
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in December 2010. The service was really good and the staff was very friendly. My room was very clean and comfortable and I really liked that there was a kitchen in the room. To my surprise there was free breakfast, dinner, free wifi and free parking. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Felt Like a Seniors Home ...”
Reviews.Author: sam_and_jaime
Reviews.Content: Felt more like a hospital than a hotel ... Overpriced and uninspiring in every way. You would be better off to stay at the Garden Inn on ~the same property. Worst internet ever. Slow and unstable.

Reviews.Title: “Every stay is like coming home and being welcomed by your 'Best Friends'.”
Reviews.Author: dlbconsulting
Reviews.Content: The title of my review of the Homewood Suites is a bit over the top; but, since I have had the pleasure of visiting the Homewood Suites more than 350 nights in the past 37 months, I know what I am talking about. They have gone above and beyond the call of duty to make me feel so very much at home, even when business takes me away from my home. You could not ask for a more delightful and welcoming General Manager, than Ann Marie. Her staff is a replicated extension of her professionalism, friendliness, and attentiveness to the needs of the client. There's Andrew, Noemi, Michael and Dan that have remained my constant consierges at the reception desk since my early visits. Their kind and refreshing personalities make you feel as though you truly have been missed since your last visit. They have gone out of way on so many occasions to make my stays just a little more special. Like handwritten welcome notes in my room, leaving my favorite Diet Coke and ice water in the fridge, a gift basket of snacks if I have a late night check in, offering special front door parking if the hour is late, . . . the list could go on for many paragraphs. During your stay, you must not miss the simple, but good, healthy food served up each morning and Monday thru Thursday evenings by my two favortite dining room ladies, Norma and Norma. They are the best and ready to assist you with a smile and a friendly hello. I couldn't possibly name each of the 20 wonderful ladies who provide housekeeping service, but they too, should be commended for doing a great job always with a smile. This is a great team at the Homewood Suites and a team that meshes together so well like this, doesn't happen by accident. They all work together to make this a very nice place to come back to. Whether for business or pleasure this is a property that I would highly recommend. If you get a chance to visit, tell'em Ms. Bailey sent you.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gelrog
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this hotel and it was very well kept. The staff was fantastic and on multiple occasions went out of their way to make our stay special. Andrew the Operations Manager was excellent. My son has pretty severe food allergies and can only eat certain foods. Several days in a row both Andrew and Anne Marie were able to get a few types of foods that were not in the morning buffet but were in the partner hotel next door. This allowed us to have breakfast as a family at the hotel instead of going out for food. I recommend this hotel without hesitation. The beds were amazing. When we arrived home we decided to get a mattress cover like they have in the hotel and have not regretted it. It's funny that you don't notice how nice bedding can be until you sleep in really nice sheets and mattresses.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely fine”
Reviews.Author: weepinwillow
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 5 and recently stayed at this hotel. First of all, the breakfast was great, my kids loved the waffle making station. My husband loved the free beer at the afternoon reception-a very nice touch. We originally booked a 1 bedroom suite, which we immediately realized would get very small, very quickly. The television didnt work and maintenance did come up and fix the issue-the cable had been pulled out of the wall-we also asked for a cot, which we needed to remind the desk of a few times, they did take care of it.. the lock on the door was also messed up and maintenance had to addess that as well .we asked to switch rooms and they did upgrade us for a fee-we are hilton honors gold members, and based on previous reviews, i thought that we wouldnt be charged off season (or shoulder season), but we were. The rooms were clean, the pool was small, and the hot tub looked questionable. The location for us was perfect, everything was 15-30 minute drive, which was fine.- The new room also had a broken tv, but they did swap it out. The hotel rooms are not set up with wireless-just one ethernet cable-a little old school, but fine-I would recommend this hotel if you want a reasonably priced room-but if there are more than 4 of you - you will want the 2 bedroom suite. If you are a hilton honors member, lower your expectations, you won't get any special treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Warm and friendly makes being away from home bearable.”
Reviews.Author: mahe6847
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a number of times and I am always amazed at how friendly and accommodating the staff is. I travel frequently and the quality and variety of the complimentary food is by far the best I have experienced and I would willingly pay for such quality offerings. The rooms are spacious and comfortable and I have and continue to recommend this hotel to friends and other business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Best value hotel in San Diego area.”
Reviews.Author: S.Fong
Reviews.Content: Family friendly hotel with so many free amenities. Not only do you get a free full breakfast, you also get Monday through Thursday a "welcome home" dinner. Beer and wine included. This saves you a bundle especially as you travel with family. Additionally, parking and in room internet is free as well. This all adds up and ends up saving you and your family vacation a bundle. The location is just north of La Jolla. This is a great location to be just south and minutes from Legoland and just north and minutes from La Jolla and downtown San Diego. It's a quiet neighborhood in a suburban area. Our room was a suite with a kitchen. Let me repeat...kitchen...which includes a full refrigerator, sink, and dishwasher. The rooms have plates and dishes as well if you feel the need to cook. Beds were very comfortable. However, the sofa bed was not. Then again, I don't think any sofa bed is comfortable. TVs are old and outdated, but functional. Great to have two tvs so the parents can watch something different than the children. The staff service were generally nice. Nothing extremely out of the ordinary in terms of excellent or poor service. The pool was a bit too small. Overall, our family really enjoyed our stay. Our vacation budget especially loved it.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: Mozmommy
Reviews.Content: Great Service, Friendly staff, CLEAN, Simply one of the best experiences.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome staff, great hotel, only drawback is the smokers”
Reviews.Author: VancouverIris
Reviews.Content: We loved the staff at this hotel, they were probably the most helpful, friendly courteous staff we have ever encountered at a hotel. The pool is small, but we found that this wasn't an issue for us as we were in the off season and the pool was not busy. The free breakfast is incredible and we were amazed by the "welcome home" reception that the hotel runs during the weeknights, we didn't have to spend money on dinner as the reception was a dinner with wine, salad bar and hot entrees. It was amazing! The garden inn next door has an great happy hour with great drink and food specials, so you have another alternative close by. The only drawback that we found was the smokers. There were so many people smoking on the patio that you couldn't sit out there, and the corridors would often smell of cigarette smoke. The staff try very hard to remove to the cigarette smell, but we really wished that the hotel was non-smoking. The walls can be thin between the rooms as we could hear the tv in the room next door and on the other wall we could hear someone snoring. The bathroom fan is loud enough that you can drown out most noise.

Reviews.Title: “2 thumbs up - great place to stay would go there again”
Reviews.Author: HIFamilyof5
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay. Traveled with my hubby and 3 kids (12,5, and 3) and was able to squeeze ourselves into a one bedroom suite. Hotel is central and close to San Diego attractions (San Diego Zoo, Sea World, Legoland, San Diego Wild Animal Park). Lots of parking and great dinner and breakfast. Loved getting a fresh breakfast and coming home to a nice dinner (complete with salad). My hubby loved the free beer Monday-Thursday night with dinner. Would definely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “great stay!”
Reviews.Author: sjerseyjo17
Reviews.Content: what a great value for your buck! free breakfast, free parking, free internet. what more can you ask for? the location is perfect if you don't mind a quick 10-15 drive into the city. it's close to la jolla (next town over) and just a couple of miles from the heart of san diego. we got the studio suite. clean, decorated elegantly, and just the perfect size for us! didn't have time to check out the gym or pool so i can't comment on those. the only con i have about this place is to work on the the breakfast; eggs were soggy, muffins & croissants were stale, coffee was okay. i'd stay here again, but maybe get breakfast somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “It was a wonderful place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: travellingguy84
Reviews.Content: This past August my wife and I celebrated our one year anniversary in the San Diego area. On this trip we went to the San Diego Zoo, the Wild Animal Park, and the Birch Aquarium. We stayed at the Homewood Suites Del Mar and found it to be a very comfortable and clean place. The room was immaculate. The location was in a safe and quiet part of town. The parking was easy and free. The free breakfast in the morning was very good and fresh. The people at the front desk were very efficient and polite. The check in was simple, easy and fast. I couldn't possibly think of one bad thing to say about this hotel experience. To me, everything was perfect and I know we will stay here again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: my2centsCalifornia
Reviews.Content: Staff is the best. Our Fox rental car couldn't move at a very inopportune moment. I asked the front desk to call a cab for us. The recepetionist offered to have the hotel shuttle takes us to our destination - UCSD move in day - with many boxes of my son's belongings. Great service - probably save us from messing up our son's first official task at the university. The rooms are functional and spacious. However, my beef is with the bath rooms. Both bathrooms have traces of mildew around the edge of the shower stall. The shower was weak in water pressure. I asked the receptionist to change room and Mike gladely complied. But the replacement room is only marginally better. I ended up checking in at the Hilton Torres Pine - 10 minutes away. Mike was so gracious, he gave me a small discount for my inconenience. I wish the bathrooms are better maintained so that I can give them a 100% positive review.

Reviews.Title: “top notch place”
Reviews.Author: Yankeeboys
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great-only about 15-20 minute ride to downtown, same for Legoland, clean, friendly personnel, easy on/off from I-5. Mon to Thursday hotel provides a light dinner and bottles of re/white wine and Firehouse ale. We loved the barbeque on Thursday night by the pool. Breakfast in morning was good-fresh fruit, eggs everyday, cereal, baked goodsetc. Staff worked hard during the busy rush to ensure all was always replenished and clean. A great place to stay...nice running path nearby. Also nearby is a shopping center with a Vons, Subway, Italian restaurant, Chinese and Greek places. Will definitely stay here again when back in San Diego. Kudos to the terrific staff for making our stay an enjoyable one.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for traveling with toddler”
Reviews.Author: SFMom2bg
Reviews.Content: Nice suite, plenty of space for toddler to run around. Has a full size kitchen which was so great in prepping our toddlers meals. Very clean, and decor is current. Good breakfast and close to old town and sea world. free parking and plenty of it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Excellent Staff/Management”
Reviews.Author: Robertsonland
Reviews.Content: We checked in for an 8 night stay and when I booked, I was told it was a queen bed. I had stayed in Homewood Suites before (travel for a living) and no one mentioned that the queen room isn't a room like the other suites are. It's a single room with one TV (that really only one side of the room can watch. We had myself, my wife and 2 kids with us and there wasn't even enough room in the dresser to keep our folded clothes for the 4 of us on an 8 night trip. I went to the Front Desk and mentioned how no one told me about the non-separated rooms and that an 8 night stay just wouldn't work with 2 kids in the sleeper sofa. I was told they were sold out and nothing they can do. Finally I spoke with the manager and she got us in to a king for the week. We only had one night in the one bedroom. They were great about moving out stuff for us while we were at Sea World and other than a "lost" remote for our Zune it went smoothly. They found the remote late the following day thankfully. The staff for the breakfast were as friendly as can be and kept asking how our stay was going and what we were off to do that day. I will definitely stay here again the next time we head to San Diego for a family vacation. Just make sure you ask about the room you are reserving as they aren't all "suites" in the way the king rooms are suites.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel - good deal for family”
Reviews.Author: montrealer2
Reviews.Content: Greetings, We stayed at homewood suites in del mar for one week at end of June. Family of four including two teenagers. We booked a king bed suite adjacent to the pool using the hilton web site for 200$ plus tax a night. The suite was quite nice (ground floor) with bay window that opened on a small table + chairs area with view on the pool. The masters room was quite nice, great king bed, comfy bed, great pillows, i had great nights of sleep no problem. Very little noise from the outside. Rooms are well insulated. The living area was nice as well, altough the sofa bed was a bit rudimentary. The two teenagers slept on it but complained a bit on the comfort of the sofa bed so i would not recommend it for adults. The pool is nice, there is a jacuzzi as well (small) but quite handy after a full day of sightseeing in order to relax. The staff was very helpful and friendly, the self-parking around the hotel, very easy to go by. There are no restaurants at the hotel but you can walk across to the hilton garden inn and you have a quite decent restaurant - we tried it one evening - with decent food and prices. There is as well a snack bar at the hilton garden inn where they have great sandwiches, we always loaded up with food to go at the snack bar before we hit the road towards the beaches, parks, etc... You must have a car to visit around. There is a von's grocery store less than five minutes drive, so you can get all you need as well for snacks or if you want to use the kitchenette area in the suite to cook your own meals. The breakfast buffet was quite OK and it's included with your room fee. If you are back at the hotel between 17h and 19h from monday-thursday evening, you even have the managers reception free of charge. On Thursday evening they had a nice BBQ and salad bar outside by the pool area... free of charge... so we loaded up before hitting the road to go to the padres baseball game downtown. It is a very nice hotel and i would say very convenient for a family. The only drawback is that the hotel is a bit remote from the main san diego areas, it's location is however easy access from highway 5. Our favorite beach from our trip : La Jolla Shores (beautiful beach!). Our favorite nature hike : torrey pines state reserve (10 minutes drive from the hotel) a must see i would say. Our favorite attraction : san diego zoo and balboa park. It's a great area. I definitely recommend both the destination and the hotel. /Montrealer2

Reviews.Title: “Suites, dinner and breakfast, allright!”
Reviews.Author: mehudson1
Reviews.Content: Very nice accomodations. New, free "dinner" and free breakfast near all the companies and the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Delighted we stayed here; would return”
Reviews.Author: Eric1004
Reviews.Content: Great experience. Extremely helpful staff. I echo other positive comments. This place is fantastic -- for what it is. It is not a Four Seasons or Ritz-Carlton. It IS an extremely well-run, comfortable, pleasant, clean and enjoyable place to stay, especially with a family (we were two adults and two kids, 5 and 7). Our trip combined theme parks and a conference downtown. The hotel was well situated for all of our activities -- a manageable drive to all of our destinations, and also close enough to the beach areas of Del Mar and La Jolla to make those readily accessible.
