Breakfasts were good; evening snacks/meals were fine for a traveling family looking for something decent and easy, but not a restaurant experience. Of course, it wasn't intended to be, and it was just right for what we needed on two evenings -- something convenient, easy, and kid-friendly after a long day with children who couldn't make it through a restaurant meal. The deli next door is good and convenient for sandwiches to go. Parking is easy and plentiful. The pool is small, but still a nice respite and more than sufficient for the kids. If I were traveling exclusively on business, and for a couple of days, I'd likely stay elsewhere. But if I were returning to San Diego to do theme parks, beach, and some downtown activities (zoo, Padres, USS Midway), this is the first place I'd try to reserve. One tiny complaint: fold-out sofa and rollaway mattreses are AWFUL. Note to owner: replace these, please.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel for value”
Reviews.Author: ourfamily2010
Reviews.Content: The staff was very nice and friendly, no issues at all. The living room was very cramped once used the pull out bed, which could use upgrading. Main bedroom and bed is nice but Don't sleep on the pull out if you have back issues. Breakfast at the hotel was ok, not much fruit or healthy food, very carbo loaded just in if you trying to eat healty. Our family was very disappointed with the pool. Very small and the kids wouldn't step foot in the jaccuzi, they said it looked too green and dirtly and were disappointed by it. Not too many additional amenities on property for kids otherwise. Probably better for business travelers without kids. Parking free and easy to find.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, great service and lots of amenities!”
Reviews.Author: srp73
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The location was kind of odd, but otherwise I don't have any complaints. It was close to the freeway, so it was easy to get in and out. Not far from downtown, but the price was incredibly reasonable. The room was fabulous...lots of space, very clean, even a complete kitchen. Awesome place to stay with young kids. The meals were great - full breakfast every morning and dinner offered during the week. Totally saved a ton of money because we didn't have to eat out!

Reviews.Title: “great value and huge rooms make for a decent stay”
Reviews.Author: DownunderSugarglider
Reviews.Content: this hotel isnt a glam winner but the rooms are huge, and the price is low making it a great deal. OK - the things I am not completely happy with: the bathroom - no tub, and the shower is one of those plastic modules, no tea and milk. too bad if you don't drink coffee. Walls are a bit thin and the yelling kids are noticeable. Also I had a herd of elephants in the room above me. Free Internet - only cable in the rooms and wifi in the lobby. Quite slow though. Breakfast is free but it is carbo and sugar heavy with packaged cereals, toast station, danish/pastries, waffles, oatmeal, and a hot dish - scrambled eggs or once I had deep fried frenchtoast sticks - whatever they are! Free parking. The location suited me because it was close to my business location, but it is no where near any tourist sites - so you must have a car - and a map! the room has a kitchen in it - which I didn't use but I suppose if you are staying in for a while for business or have a family. Once I had checked in I never saw another cast member so I can't say much about their service. I used thei fitness centre which was a bit cheap and only 1 of each machine and a bit small. 1 treadie, 1 row machine, 1 stairclimber and 1 of those multi pull down machines. This hotel will suit anyone who wants a bit of extra room, has a car for getting around and is looking for a great deal at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “This was the greatest hotel”
Reviews.Author: Denise-TRIP
Reviews.Content: Loved our stay! On check-in, we were instantly upgraded to a 2 bedroom suite. We had requested a quiet room away from the elevator and were given just that - never heard a sound the whole time we were there. The room and grounds were immaculate. Free breakfast and dinner (with beer and wine in the evening) were delicious and the selection was great. Only a short 10-15 minute drive to all the attractions in San Diego. We'd stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, great location, good atmosphere.”
Reviews.Author: orangenkitty
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at this hotel while we did some traveling and checked out some major attractions. The location was perfect. It was close enough to be within driving distance of everything, and yet far enough away from the city center to be quiet and relaxing. The hotel was clean, and our one bedroom (2 Queen Beds) plus Living Room Sofa Bed made great accommodations for us and our two teens. The kitchenette was a bonus for us. The real treat came when dinner was served. I was pleasantly surprised to find our dinner came with our hotel package. We only ate in the lobby 2 out of the 3 times, but each meal was very delicious and healthy. Both beer and wine were offered, as well as sweet tea and lemonade. Salad was always offered along with the main dish and one side. It was a bit too cool for the pool, but the area around it was clean and comfortable. Would recommend this hotel for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific value and great location made this a winner”
Reviews.Author: cinemarama
Reviews.Content: Checked around quite a bit before selecting this hotel and ended up being happy with the choice. It turned out to be a great place for families. The weekday dinners/receptions were welcome after full days out at Sea World and Legoland. Especially enjoyed the barbeque in the pool area. The breakfast selection is good and includes a scrambled egg dish and some sort of side - bacon, sausage, etc. Fruit and beverages are available all day. It was handy having a first floor room with direct access to the pool area. The location and easy highway access were perfect for visiting all the parks, especially the Wild Animal Park and Legoland. The neighborhood is a corporate/residential mix with many restaurants just a short (driving) distance away. We particularly appreciated the helpfulness and great attitude of the staff. They seem happy you are there. A special shout out to the housekeeping staff (Narcisa), who did a great job. The kids especially enjoyed coming back each day to see which shape the towels had been folded into. My only wish would be that the living room of the suite was a tiny bit bigger. With the sofa bed open it was a little tight getting around, but not an issue. Great value and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Price”
Reviews.Author: VaBest1
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites Del Mar is one of the better hotels I have stayed. Accommodations and amenities are great for the price. Very clean (I did see a silver fish under the counter but not really a big deal), most of the staff was just a little overly friendly for my liking, but very helpful. Breakfast was ok (I did not like the eggs and no turkey bacon) and the pool was nice. Two problems I had, one is that I’m a very hard sleeper. So, when I had the deadbolt and the security latch on the door, housekeeping and maintenance took the deadbolt off and cut security latch. They came in while I’m lying across the bed in my underwear and awaken me. They said they tried to called, but didn’t get an answer. I was sleep. I felt humiliated once I woke up knowing someone had been in my room. The manager did comp me one night. The second problem I had were the points that I earned. I spent $4467.00, I should have earned 44,671 base points and 11,167 bonus points for gold, but what I received was 39,690 base points and 9,922 bonus points for gold plus 1,000 service center adjustment points. With all of that being said, I would stay again at this location. I think the few problems I had were all isolated problems.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Kailuagrinds
Reviews.Content: We chose this property after looking through the TA reviews and it did not disappoint. - very friendly staff - clean and quiet - free breakfast and evening welcome home meals - free parking - spacious suites - comfortable beds - great water pressure in shower - mini kitchen - easy on to freeway and close to attractions I would stay here again in a heartbeat

Reviews.Title: “Agree with previous good reviews, but had one disappointment..”
Reviews.Author: pdavis108
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the great reviews about this hotel. The staff and manager do go out of their way to make you comfortable and happy. When my husband and I travel, we try to find a hotel that offers breakfast and free parking, this one met our criteria and then some by including dinner. We did have ONE DISAPPOINTMENT during our stay however. One afternoon, we returned to our room about 4:00 p.m. and I noticed the bathroom door was shut. When I went in, there was a very strong smell of cigarette smoke!. (We do not smoke and always ask for a non smoking room). This was fresh smoke and I know for a fact that someone was just in there smoking prior to our return! I called the front desk right away to let them know and to ask for fresh clean towels. Someone brought the towels and some air freshner, which I guess was all that could be done for us at that point. It's rather disappointing and infuriating to know that an employee goes in to a guest room/bathroom to smoke. For all we know, this could have happened on other days of our stay and the smoke disappated before we got back, or it could have happened in someone else's room too. I don't know what management did to look in to this matter when I reported it, but hopefully they found out who it was and let that employee go. Despite that, I do recommend this hotel for all the positives we did experience. One suggstion I have for the hotel to consider is installing a towel bar or hooks on the door to hang towels. Patty D.

Reviews.Title: “LIVES UP TO ALL THE REVIEWS!”
Reviews.Author: Chichikoko
Reviews.Content: Myself, my husband and our two sons, 4&7 stayed at the Homewood Suites in Del Mar for 7 days. I chose this hotel based solely on the reviews it received on this website and I was not let down in any way. It is in a perfect location for visiting the tourist attractions in San DIego. We went to the Zoo, Legoland and Seaworld and not one was more that 20 minutes away. They offer free parking which I found was something rare at most hotels in the San DIego area. From arrival to departure, everything went very smoothly. The hotel is very clean and well taken care of. The staff is friendly and welcoming. The complimentary breakfast buffet every morning was wonderful and we enjoyed the complimentary dinners from Monday to Thursday. My eldest son is a picky eater and he always found something he enjoyed eating. Probably saved at least $50-75 a day in food costs just by staying here. The free internet in the business center was great too. The rooms are very spacious, quiet and well laid out. The full kitchen is a great feature but we didn't really use it as the hotel provided most of our food. The fold out sofa bed was perfect for our boys but I would not recommend it for adults. The mattress is fairly thin, making it uncomfortable for a full sized adult. King sized bed in the bedroom was very comfortable and they offered several pillows in different levels of firmness. Housekeeping did a wonderful job and we always we fully stocked on anything we needed. On our final morning, we received a bill under the door. All we had to do was take our bags and leave the room keys on the table. Smoothest check out ever! I highly recommend this hotel. I would definately return to this hotel again and would even look for Homewood Suites in other areas.

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites San Diego Del Mar is FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Author: LurdleTurtle
Reviews.Content: The rooms are wonderful with nice amenities including free high speed internet and local shuttle service. The rooms were very clean. The breakfasts and dinners were outstanding and best of all the staff is out of this world helpful. We were there because my daughter had surgery and they provided personalized shuttle service beyond the scope of their regular service. When we needed transportation they were there and all the time everything that was done for us was done with a smile. In out view, this is the greatest hotel and we recommend it without reservation!

Reviews.Title: “Believe the positive reviews”
Reviews.Author: thenutkin
Reviews.Content: I had read all the glowing reveiws before our visit. Yes, I was skeptical but I needn't have been because this place lived up to every postive. Our one-bedroom suite was cosy and comfortable. Even if we didn't use all the features of the kitchen, it was nice to know they were available. The value is excellent. A very nice breakfast; the week night dinner really exceeded expectations. We had expected to dine out every night but when we saw the quality of the dinner selections we stayed at Homewood instead. A small but fresh salad bar is provided along with one main dish that is chef- prepared. Not gourmet, but quality ingredients prepared with skill to create a simple but tasty meal. Plus the free beer, wine and other beverages was a big bonus. Several readers have mentioned the excellent staff. I must agree. Both Normas were lovely and helpful. And the rest of the staff was also top-notch. Much credit must go to the owner, Mr. Rauch and the manager, Ann Marie . We met both of them and much of the success of this property is due to their hands-on approach which creates the atmosphere of comfort, care and competence that is so highly valued in a hotel. Keep up the good work, everyone. When we return to the San Diego area, we'll be sure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for family with teenager”
Reviews.Author: pandalover999
Reviews.Content: Husband and teenaged son spent 8 wonderful nights in the Homewood Suites Del Mar in April. Wonderful staff--provided great restaurant recommendations and answered all our questions politely. Super big breakfasts with variety so we never got bored with the cuisine. Monday thru Thursday hotel even has a buffet from 5 pm to 7 pm that was filling enough to skip dining out those nights. Two communal computers in a business center to check email for free. A pool and jacuzzi. Two washers and two dryers so we could keep up with laundry. Perfect hotel! Great choice! Would gladly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Not knowing what to expect but was pleasently surprised”
Reviews.Author: cindyleitz
Reviews.Content: We traveled with our 3 young boys(1 year old, 6 year old, and 9 year old.) We wanted something that was kid friendly, and close to Legoland, The Zoo, Seaworld and the beaches and even downtown. The location was perfect for us. The hotel staff was wonderful :very helpful. I used the laundry units , which was very convienant. We had very comfortable beds...better then home! They even provided a crib at no charge. We had a wonderful breakfest included in price every morning and dinner 4 of the nights too. We are very happy and would recommend this to our family and friends. They were great!

Reviews.Title: “Very well run - would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: DenverDoug88
Reviews.Content: Our family spent 5 nights in 1-bedroom suites - rooms 101 and 301 - in late March (Spring Break), and found it to be a very good experience. This property is very well run, with gracious and helpful front desk staff, maid service that does a great job and is highly responsive to requests, and a breakfast buffet staff that makes the free, hot breakfast a very positive experience regardless of the mess guests can cause. We liked the hot breakfasts (a good money saver for families) but you need to like scrambled eggs, as varieties of them will be the main focus daily. The rooms are somewhat non-descript but clean and well-cased for. The sleeper sofas for kids are pretty basic (and not popular withour kids). The location was reasonably convenient to beach access in Del Mar (10 min), grocery stores (5 min) and San Diego (less than 30 min if not rush hour). The small outdoor pool and hot tub are useful but were busy while we were there. The high speed internet is wireless only in the lobby area (wired connection in the room - a disappointment). The only warning is for folks using the online directions for the hotel from SAN airport, that directs you towards Exit 33A. Get off at Exist 32 (Carmel Mountain Rd) lest you like getting lost.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean, excellent meals, great service, top value -- 100%!”
Reviews.Author: Escape-to-SD
Reviews.Content: Just completing a 60-day Feb-Mar stay with complete satisfaction. Stayed here for two months in 2008-09 also and returned because everything is done extremely well. Entire building, including rooms, are immaculately clean. Meals (dinner & breakfast buffets) are varied and excellent, prepared by Master Chef at Hilton Gardens next door. Front desk is 100% helpful, accomodating and friendy. Value for the price is also excellent. We expect to be back here for another two months or longer within the next year. Spouse comment - why do I have to go home when everything is taken care of perfectly here?!?

Reviews.Title: “A home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: WisconsinJules
Reviews.Content: The staff went out of their way to help us with our stay in San Diego. They gave directions and advice in the most friendliest of ways. We left each morning having had a breakfast that met everyone's tastes. When we returned in the evening a meal awaited us. We were blown away with what was included in this hotel's price. The room cleanliness each day was amazing! We will search for this type of hotel in the future. And we definitely plan to go back to the Del Mar location. WOW!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - which were high!”
Reviews.Author: karenwt
Reviews.Content: We booked here in part because of the high ratings, which meant our expectations were high too. Room was good - kitchen was small, with no stove - but given their morning breakfasts and the fantastically delicious evening dinners (manager's welcome is usually a bowl of chips and salsa anywhere else) we were blown away. Full meals, salad bar, fresh and very good. Everything was clean, the staff were very helpful and even the suits came out of their offices during breakfast to help clear plates, put out food and mingle. Their motto was make yourself at home and we did - using the bbq and setting up our w/end meals in the dining area, with smiles all around (no dirty looks at the kids or dirty dishes). My only regret is not taking advantage of the early booking rate which would've saved us more $$. Family with 6, 8 & 10yr old. And they were extremely accommodating to our 6 yr old's allergies, letting me read the ingredient lists and finding out first hand about things. It was difficult to find in the dark from the airport, but that wasn't their fault.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but get a room on the top floor if you can!”
Reviews.Author: callen21
Reviews.Content: Spent two nights here on our family vacation when visiting the San Diego area - we really enjoyed our stay except for noise- it sounded like a group of irish step dancers were staying in the room above us -the loud plodding of the guests above us made sleep difficult. The hotel was completely booked and was unable to move us to the highest floor. Other than that we really enjoyed our stay. The staff was great- very helpful and friendly. The rooms were comfortable and tastefully decorated. Room and the hotel was very clean. Great breakfast and they also serve delicious dinners during the week.

Reviews.Title: “The feeling of being welcomed”
Reviews.Author: ddenn45
Reviews.Content: As Hilton Honors members, my wife and I have stayed at many Hilton Hotels including Homewood Suites and Hilton Garden. I personally have stayed at nearly a a dozen different Homewood Suites around the country as a result of business travel. The Homewood Suites in San Diego/Del Mar is particularly special. Everyone from the front desk to the kitchen works extra hard to make our stay special. We have stayed at this hotel on three different occasions. In particular I would like to say a special thanks to Andrew Kalfayan, Operations Mgmt. and Norma Rodriguez, who runs the kitchen. Andrew is a very personable young man who goes the extra mile to make everyone feel at home. Norma Rodrigues, along with the other Norma and Carla in the kitchen do an excellent job each and every day. If your looking for a hotel for a short or particulary an extended stay, this is the hotel for you. If your looking for a family place, this is it. Dinner four nights a week with welcome hour with wine and beer and breakfast seven days a week all included in the cost of your room. We highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel had everything we needed and more”
Reviews.Author: familytime00
Reviews.Content: This hotel was clean, nice and the staff were very friendly and helpful. It was within close driving range of everything and the front desk had maps and directions to wherever we wanted to go. The breakfast was great and on during the weekdays they provided dinners too. The pool was clean and heated. The only down-side would be that the pool area is pretty shaded. This is a great hotel for families and very comfortable suites.

Reviews.Title: “Home away for tired road warrior”
Reviews.Author: wandererPhilly
Reviews.Content: I arrived near midnight local time after 10 hours of air travel and was welcomed graciously and quickly. Free full breakfast was very tasty and free dinner with beer were wonderful after a long day of meetings. I'd stayed happily at the Hilton garden inn next door, but this property is so much more welcoming! Example, the note on my fridge with the free dinner menu for the week, plus weekly events. Can't say enough good things about the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Clean and Spacious Rooms at Homewood Suites”
Reviews.Author: tltfaas
Reviews.Content: I just returned home after a four day adventure in San Diego. I stayed at the Homewood Suties in Del Mar. The hotel looks and feels new. Check in and check out was handled quickly and professionally. I had a king suite that had a full kitchen with all the utensils you need, a King size bed in a separate bedroom and a separate living room. You get a large bathroom, two televisions, a desk and a dining room table in your suite. Free breakfast is served everyday and weeknights offer a full dinner with beverages. The hotel was packed with families when I stayed there but inside my suite all was quiet and I slept well. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: PammyB
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while my husband was on business. Rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. We had our one year old daughter with us so having a separate lounge and a kitchen was really good. Full size fridge freezer and dishwasher in the kitchen which the staf put on each day to wash the dishes!! Breakfast provided everyday at no cost and an evening meal on week days with wine, again at no cost. Nothing round about to walk to but if you have a car then no problem as everything is really accessible. We had take out from a couple of local restaurants and also went out to eat. San Diego is beautiful with so much to do, shame our weather wasn't too good. They had the first rain in 6 months. Would definitely recommend this hotel for anyone staying in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “No Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Foghorn8508
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Thanksgiving. Location was just off the highway. Can be a bit confusing to get to, but had my trusty GPS. Property was clean, breakfast was goot, hot food was hot and cold was cold. Food was kept well stocked and there was a daily variety in either the eggs for meat that was served. Too cool to go swimming, but it looked well kept. Did not take part in the Managers reception in the evening, but others said it was good. Internet was free and fast. Good selection of TV stations. Room had a few maintenace issues that were resolved in less than an hour (Loose door hinge tht would not let the bathroom door close and a light bulb that was out.) Parking was free, lot well lit. Located in the middle of an office park and high rent housing area so felt very safe.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous”
Reviews.Author: wendilicious21
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous time at this hotel! It was very clean and the staff was very accommodating. We loved how beautiful the rooms were. I traveled with my mom, who is very picky about accommodations and she was extremely impressed. Thank you for a wonderful time!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel with nice breakfast included and mini buffet dinner w/ wine and beer on weekdays”
Reviews.Author: hailes
Reviews.Content: I think the title says it all, but it's nice to find a hotel with waffles, eggs, coffee, juice, creals and breads included for free. The added bonus was that there was even nice wine and beer from a tap also for free during the weekday evenings, but check before going. They also had a mini buffett with a nice simple salad and some other food. I wished they had a vegetarian option other than the meat option for the buffet, but can't complain since it was free. The location is easy and close to the beach if you have a car. If not, it's too far to walk. But, there's a free shuttle that can drop you at the beach area in Del Mar and then pick you up when you're ready. The walls are a bit thin so you can somewhat hear your neighbors. The rooms are nicely decorated, but I'd wish they'd lose the silk plants. They are just dust collectors no matter how clean a room is. Couldn't they just get a simple real potted plant that does not require a lot of water? The flat screen TV was nice, and the bed had a poor quality mattress. I think you just need to make sure you really get a suite, as we thought we'd have one, and to our suprise, it was just a couch on the other side of the room opposite the bed! We were traveling with a small baby and wanted that extra room to be able to not disturb her when she was sleeping. I hear from others that the rooms do differ and some are really suite like with a separation between rooms, so make sure you ask for what you want if they have it available. I'd stay here again. Front desk was friendly and helpful. Next door is a SPA at the Hilton Garden Inn and I got a nice hair cut. It's a bit pretentious there with all the Spa rules though..they have a SPA Etiquette list on the back of the pamplet that made me almost not go there. I ended up going anyway to the spa for a haircut with my daughter and it was empty. Not sure why all the rules, but per the rules, they don't want kids (i.e ones that can make noise). Luckily they let me bring my kid who was good, but who wants to go to a place where you're not really welcome with your little one? I would have spent a heck of a lot more money there if they were more welcoming with in their pamplet. And especially since it was empty, don't think my kid would have disturbed anyone except the other staff if I had stayed to get a massage and facial!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel perfect as home base for San Diego County attractions”
Reviews.Author: euromchiu
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at Homewood suites in Del Mar. I was travelling with a pregnant wife and 18 month kid, so my needs were somewhat demanding, and Homewood delivered. The suites provided all the amenities that we wanted and served as a good focal point for all the san diego attractions. Shops are nearby and the neighborhood is upscale.

Reviews.Title: “You need to stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: danandkel1508
Reviews.Content: My Husband and our three young children all of whom are under 6 years old could not have asked for a better place to stay. We tare from Philadelphia and this was our first time to San Diego. I had booked our stay here under the hIlton Honors rewards program very blindly and did not research this hotel prior ot our stay here. We stayed for three nights 10/13 thru 10/16 and were so impressed I needed to write a review, which I haver never done. Everything was Fabulous, from the room to the staff to the free food!!! You don't get much for free these days so we were blown away to say the least!!! The breakfast and dinners at this hotel......which was FREE were awesome! We arrived very tired after a very long day of travel with three small chidlren and 2 planes to get to Ca. We arrived around 5:00pm checked in and went righ into dinner, which was so nice, It was taco bar night, our childrens favorite and it was really good! Plus they offered free beer and wine, you can't beat that!! What a savings for our family to have 3 breakfasts and 3 dinners at no cost. If we ever return to the San Diego area we will defintley be staying here!!! Thanks to the staff for making our stay so wonderful! The Hartranft Family

Reviews.Title: “easy access to freeways make everything close”
Reviews.Author: DonkArizona
Reviews.Content: Service was fantastic, felt very welcome. Morning breakfast buffet and evening reception was very enjoyable with a nice variety. Close to many nice beaches and the freeway access made going anywhere very easy. Pool area was very clean and not crowded this time of year. Hot tub was also very nice. Only problem we had were some tiny ants in the kitchen area. Business room made it very easy to check e-mail from home and to print out your boarding passes for the flight home. Only place to stay for us next time we go to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: JVJW-NZ
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a four nights and we were really impressed. The staff are fantastic and helpful. The room was as expected and very clean. The only issue was that the spare, pullout, bed had been broken at some stage and badly repaired making it very uncomfortable. We chose this hotel as it was a little way out of the city and very quiet. I don't think I would stay without a car. We will definately stay again and do recommend

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NickBracho
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to spend a few days with the family. Clean, friendly staff, nice neighbourhood. It has the Homewood Suites quality and then more ! The location is stragically close to two large highways, but not so close that you get the noise.

Reviews.Title: “Best Service!!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_NYC2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites Del Mar for a few nights in August. The service at the hotel couldn't be any better. Members of the staff went out of their way to assist us during our stay. We had left the headlights of our car on one night, and Dan ("the night nerd") called the local police in order to track down who the car had belonged to. Needless to say, they found out that it was our rental car and we were able to turn off the lights before the battery died. Dan even walked me out to ensure that everything was ok (it was 3am!). On another day, my friend had gotten hurt during our bike tour. Everyone at the front desk / mini store gave us every medical item (bandaids, neosporin, alcohol wipes,etc) they were able to find and gave it to us free of charge because they wanted us to get back to our wounded friend ASAP. The free breakfast was excellent and there was always plenty of food. If I were to return to San Diego, I would definitely stay at this hotel again!!

Reviews.Title: “Deserves it's good reputation”
Reviews.Author: Flashbaak
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a quiet area off the freeway. The rooms were very nice, clean, comfortable. The breakfast was great! Lots of good reviews on this hotel, and rightfully so. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for traveling with young children”
Reviews.Author: AZtk71
Reviews.Content: Better than we could have expected. Stayed in a one bedroom suite which had sofa bed for our girls(2 and 5). Room was extremely clean and staff was more than helpful and accomodating. It was very nice to have a kitchen with refigerator for snacks, milk, etc for our kids. Breakfast was very good and better than expected for free. I thought the waffles were excellent. Free Internet and Parking were also a plus as the other hotels we were looking at in San Diego charged for both. Nice location as we went south to SeaWorld, north to Legoland and it was very close to beaches at Del Mar and La Jolla. Will definitely be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “very supprised”
Reviews.Author: pinultima
Reviews.Content: the hotel was better as expected staff was superfriendly and hotel was clean food was good good location to go to seaworld and the beach i recommed this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Baileybasset
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at Homewood Suites while attending San Diego Wild Animal Park and Del Mar Racetrack. This hotel was located right off of the I-5 freeway in a business area, but grocery stores and restaurants were a short and easy drive from the hotel. The hotel provided easy freeway access to I-5 and Ted Williams Parkway. Hotel staff were friendly and efficient. Parking was free. The room was clean, comfortable and had a small kitchen that included full size refrigerator/freezer, small stove, coffeemaker and dishwasher. Bathroom was roomy with a very good shower. The area outside of the bathroom door where the sink was located was cramped when someone was trying to come in or out of the bathroom door. There were two TVs and a sofa bed. The air conditioning worked very well and it was possible to open the two windows slightly (about 3"). Also, the bedroom had a multi-speed ceiling fan. Wireless Internet was not available from the room, but was available at the hotel. There wasn't a restaurant or bar at the hotel, but the Hilton Garden Inn next door did offer them. There was a small store that sold snacks and necessities. A complimentary breakfast was provided that had eggs and a side dish plus make your own toast, waffles, cereal, fruit, etc. The breakfast was adequate, but personally, I'd have preferred a few more choices or cooked to order like Embassy Suites offers. For bird lovers......at dusk we witnessed 100+ crows arriving for the night to roost in the treetops and building roof tops across from the hotel. Amazing sight to see.

Reviews.Title: “Small suites, small pool and average food.”
Reviews.Author: bassy92
Reviews.Content: Having read the reviews for the suites, we were excited to stay here. I guess I expected too much. While the reviews were spot on that the rooms are clean and the staff very good, the rooms were tiny for our family (parents and 14 and 10 year old boys.). With the sofa sleeper pulled out, there is no room to move, there is just a tiny table, etc. We were tripping over each other (and we were there for a week!) If there was a top quality Embassy Suites in the area, I would have moved. Embassy has more room, and bigger kitchen table, but the trade off would be a small fridge vs. full size at the Homewood suites (which was nice). Unfortunately, the Embassy Suites in San Diego does not have good reviews. The pool was very small - great for small kids, but not much room to move. Only about 10 chairs by the pool. The food was average at best. The eggs were runny every morning. And the enchiladas were gross! I will say the staff did an excellent job keeping up with things and kept food stocked and the areas very clean. Kudos to housekeeping. We went to the beach a few times, and as much as we tried not to, we still tracked in a lot of sand to the room. The housekeeping staff did a great job of getting all the sand out of our tub, off the floors, etc. Overall - I'd recommend this hotel to small families, or with small children. If you have older kids or bigger family, this is not the place for you unless you don't mind very close quarters.

Reviews.Title: “Throughly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Ballyhack5
Reviews.Content: Having read the TA reviews of the Homewood Suites in San Diego, we certainly looked forward to our stay. We were not disappointed, the hotel is great and the staff could not have been more helpful. As stated in other reviews, the breakfasts and evening meals were of good quality. A car is certainly required, and there are so many great beaches and other things to do to visit within a short drive. Try the Fish Market restaurant at Solana Beach

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service and amenities!”
Reviews.Author: clg
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Homewood Suites for 4 nights with our 8 year old son. Our one bedroom suite was the perfect size and we loved having the fridge/kitchen area to keep and prepare small snacks. The breakfast and evening reception were a great option to eating out everyday and it was so nice to have the hot food available rather than just a continental breakfast. The Thursday BBQ was really great with salads, chicken, burgers and hotdogs available. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful and the cleaning staff did a great job keeping our room well stocked with clean towels (and obviously keeping the room clean on a regular basis because the rooms were spotless!). We also enjoyed the NY Deli at the Garden Inn next door for great sandwiches. The location was also perfect and allowed for an easy drive to everything we wanted to do (within 15 - 20 minutes of most attractions and Del Mar beach was only minutes away). Our only disappointment was that the pool was closed for maintenance for all but one day of our stay and, although we had the option of using the pool at the Hilton next door, our son really missed the chance to hang out in the pool in the evenings after long days of activities. I highly recommend this hotel - especially to traveling families.

Reviews.Title: “Loved our Stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: AlphaRiss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Homewood Suites for about a week while visiting San Diego. We were very impressed! The hotel seems new - the facilities were in excellent condition. Our 1 bedroom suite and the public areas were all clean. The complimentary breakfast and manager’s afternoon reception were awesome. The food area was well kept up by the staff. I was especially impressed at breakfast because they had several employees making sure that the food remained well stocked and that all the guests got everything they needed. The location was central to everywhere we went (Legoland, SD zoo, Sea World) - it took us approx 20 mins to get to these parks. The hotel is tucked away near some business parks and some very nice condos. It was in an upscale area of San Diego. What struck me the most was the pride that the hotel staff had in their hotel. The hotel staff (from the front desk to the food service employees) were all helpful and professional. When we visit San Diego again, I would definitely consider staying at this Homewood Suites again!

Reviews.Title: “My home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: willywil
Reviews.Content: The location is great. The breakfast is steller. The dinner is wonderful. The service, well the service is beyond words. I am a military man, in the last 300 days I have stayed on 5 or 6 hotels for a total of 12 weeks. I rate this hotel the best that I've stayed in ever!!! Other Hotels this year include: Ramadas, Hiltons, Army Lodging, Air Force Lodging, Time Share Condos, Best Westerns, and Quality Inns... and maybe another few that wasn't worth remembering. Thanks Homewood Suites of Del Mar!!!

Reviews.Title: “Superb hotel at a great price. Includes breakfast AND dinner!”
Reviews.Author: EasyGoingTraveler77
Reviews.Content: Clean spacious rooms that are nicely appointed. That alone would be reason enough to stay here. Includes a terrific breakfast and a good dinner (Mon - Thur) which makes it a great bargain. The dinners are not fine dining, but are casual meals that are really pretty good. Lots of families stay here to take advantage of this deal. The location is not near any retail stores or restaurants, but is only 5 minutes from the freeway.

Reviews.Title: “The reviews are right!”
Reviews.Author: bnight
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fantastic. Even with the drive down to the San Diego attractions this would still be a top choice. The "evening receptions" (full dinner) and full breakfasts were certainly time and money savers! The staff was friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend for families”
Reviews.Author: codemom
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights, Monday-Thursday. I always like to research hotels and was only hesitant to choose Homewood because of the location (not close to Sea World). However, we were not disappointed! We arrived Monday afternoon, with just enough time for the kids to enjoy the pool. The "light snacks" are really a full meal. We had lasagna, bread and salad that first evening. Other nights we had fajitas with rice and beans, and stir fry with rice. Breakfast is nice hot buffet with eggs, potatoes/sausage, oatmeal, waffles, cold cereals, muffins, bagels, toast, juice and coffee. The coffee is always available in the lobby. We also used the laundry, and spent only $3 to wash and dry a full load of wet, sandy clothes. The room was great, especially when travelling with kids. We had a one bedroom suite (2 queens) and a sofa sleeper. Plenty of room for us to move around without feeling crowded. The full kitchen was very handy when the kids didn't want stir fry. I ran to the grocery store on the first night (about 1.5 miles away, easy to find) and picked up some mac and cheese, hot dogs and milk. The kitchen has only a stove top, no oven, but that was fine for us. Again, the evening meal really is a meal, not a snack. We figured we saved about $200 on meals by staying here. The room was well worth the price. The staff was very warm and friendly. The location is quiet and only about 12 miles from Sea World (easy access to the 5 freeway and maybe 10 minutes to La Jolla beaches). We absolutely would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaMomof2
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel solely based on the reviews that it has received and we were not disappointed either. We stayed for four nights (Mon - Thurs.) when they have the evening snacks as they are called. They are anything but an evening snack - there was always a main course with a side and a salad with veggies every night. The hotel room was clean and well kept and the bed was really comfortable also. Neither of our kids complained about the sofa bed. The shower head also impressed me as it is a lot taller than most hotel rooms. It is also located close to the I-5 and we were about 10 - 15 minutes away from the beaches. Overall, this was a great hotel and we would definately go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Pick for Families”
Reviews.Author: flannelpants
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 4 traveling with a 7 month old baby and had our 3 year old with us just for the weekend. We stayed for a week (11-18 June 2009) in a one bedroom suite with 2 queen beds and LOVED it! Location: For a week’s trip to the San Diego area, we LOVED Del Mar. We thought it was quite, nice, and scenic. After seeing all the sites and driving by other locations such as Hotel Circle and Gaslamp, we were so glad that we were in Del Mar instead. It could be nearly 30 minutes to some of the attracts at the wrong time of day, but it was so worth it. Room: The room is actually 3 rooms. The first is a kitchen, living room, and dining all in one. The kitchen is nearly a full kitchen including dishes, a dish washer, garbage disposal, stove, microwave, and fridge. The only thing not included is dish soap. In the living area is an average size TV. This room includes a desk. I believe high speed Internet access was available, but we didn’t bring a computer with us. The cable on the TV includes many good kid friendly channels with movies and video games for rent. The bedroom was a good size. The two queen beds were comfortable and there was plenty of room for a crib, which they provided. The sink/mirror area in actually in the bedroom. I was able to use it without waking my children. Another TV is in the bedroom. The bathroom contains a shower/bath and toilet. They were good about providing cleans towels. The cleaning service did a great job. Once they came while I was dealing with a fussy baby. She said she would come back and left right away. The best part was that they always found time to come back when we weren’t there and did a thorough job cleaning. Breakfast: They have a hot breakfast buffet everyday that includes items such as eggs, potatoes, bacon or sausage. They had cold items like yogurt, cereal, and fruit (oranges, bananas, and apples). They have the do-it-yourself waffle makers. The only truly bad thing at breakfast was the coffee. It was HORRID. I tried flavored creamers, sugars, etc, but it could NOT be saved. It consistently tasted too strong and brunt. The first day my favorite breakfast item was the seasoned potatoes with peppers and onions. They were perfect and delicious! However, in following days they were tamed down and less seasoned. I’m sure they were more kid friendly, but disappointing to me when on the first day they were so flavorful. Amenities: We used the pool once. The girl at the desk thought it was heat to 82 degrees. It felt a bit cooler than that to me. It was early evening though and probably not the best time to swim. I like that they have plenty of lounge chairs and spare towels in the pool area. The business center is just 2 computers with Internet connection. I only got on there briefly to check e-mail. It did the job, but was running slow. The laundry room is two washers and two dryers that are coin operated. I paid a total of $4 to do 2 loads. It was nice to not go home with a week’s worth of dirty laundry. They only powdered Tide in their micro store, so bring something else if you want it. We didn’t get to use the manager’s reception as we were out running around too much. Price: I thought the price was pretty decent especially considering the fact that they didn’t have parking fees or resort fees. We paid something like $175 a night plus tax. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, quiet hotel and free dinner!!!”
Reviews.Author: Cheaky44
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites in Del Mar for 3 nights before going to Carlsbad. I have to say that everything positive I read about the hotel is true and then some. We had 2 rooms next door to each other for a family of 5 - 2 of which were teenagers. I didn't even think to ask for adjoining rooms when we checked in but this worked just fine. We got there early and were able to check in right away. Each room had it's own bedroom, living room and small kitchen. The kitchen had everything you would need - a full size refrigerator, sink, dishwasher, all pots, pans, dishes, soap, utensils - everything!!! There was a stove top but no oven - no big deal. The living room had a sofa sleeper that worked perfectly for the youngest. In my personal opinion, all the furniture in the living room made it a little "tight" for space but we just moved the cocktail table out of the way and we were good. We arrived on the Thursday before Easter and had booked 3 nights at the hotel. We were starving once we unpacked and decided to go next door to the deli in the Hilton. My daughter had panini that was to die for, we had chix ceasar salads and my sons had sandwiches. It was an awesome meal - not too light but just enough to get us by until dinner that night. We went out to the pool for a little while - it was a little chilly but our littlest one was very happy being in a warm pool - even though it was 65 degrees. Pool was not real big but it was nice and clean. They also had a jacuzzi that was well taken care of. Lounge chairs around the pool and they had tables & chairs outside of the pool area to sit and have drinks or watch the kids without getting wet. Apparently, they have free dinner Sunday or Monday thru Thursday nights - COOL! So, we had grilled chix breasts, hot dogs, hamburgers, corn on the cobb, fresh cut fruit, chips, drinks etc. It was really nice after getting in from flying and not having to worry about dinner. Beds were very comfortable, pillows great and the cleaning ladies were there every day. No problems at all with anything. It is a little "secluded" and not out amongst everything but a quick drive to the expressway and very easy to find. It was a great start to our spring break vacation! I would definitely stay there again and recommend it to everyone. A+ all the way!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Value in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: gman01
Reviews.Content: I stayed three nights with the wife and two kids aged 10 and 12. The service was excellent and the staff was very friendly. The evening "reception" includes beer and wine as well as soft drinks for the kids. There is also chips and salsa as well as a nightly menu item. My kids loved the baked lasagna night as well as the enchiladas. The breakfast was also very good and had something for everyone in the family. The breakfast does not have the selection of the Embassy Suites but it is still very satisfactory. The kids were more than satisfied. The location is excellent and easily accessible from I-5 and 56. There are several shopping areas within a five minute drive. Supermarkets, banks, and restaurants are plentiful. Solana Beach and Torrey Pines are both 10-15 minutes away by car. Overall I was very happy with this property and would recommend it to anyone visiting San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Home in America”
Reviews.Author: Rgupta
Reviews.Content: Nice Hotel with good ambience. Provides Nice breakfast and evening snacks. Rooms are spacious and good. House Keeping staff is very cooperative and effiicient. Having Ample parking space.

Reviews.Title: “Worth Every Penny!!!”
Reviews.Author: choadqdc
Reviews.Content: My wife and two kids, along with another married couple decided to hit the beaches of San Diego. We chose Homewood Suites because we wanted to stay together and hang out. The room accommodated us perfectly since there was a king bed in one bedroom and two queens in the other. (The other couple didn't have any kids.) The living room was cozy and the kitchen was a bit small but well appointed. The rooms were spotless and were well appointed. I even felt comfortable enough to not wear shoes while lounging around in the living room. While the room was in the right configuration and clean, the room is not the highlight of this hotel. The staff was absolutely EXCELLENT. So often, the hotel has the goods (the rooms) but the staff is not helpful or courteous or is in some way lacking. This was not the case here. First off, we checked in kind of late (almost midnight) and the night host was chipper and cheerful. He insisted that I park right outside the front door so it would be easier to carry bags up to the room. He let us know the various amenities available in the lobby and what we could expect at breakfast. He talked it up so much, that despite my fatigue from being up so late, I got up early and went to the free breakfast buffet. It was excellent! We had decided to go to the beach, but didn't know where to go or what to do. Another helpful staffer came by to clear some of our breakfast dishes and when we asked him what to do, he gave us many suggestions and his own personal preference for the beaches. He then came back with a map of the area already highlighted and marked with directions to beaches, shopping, and local eateries he thought we might enjoy. He was right on the money with all of it. Thanks to the staff of this hotel, my family and our friends enjoyed some of the most relaxing adventures we have ever encountered and would heartily recommend this hotel (and their OUTSTANDING STAFF) to anyone and everyone. They truly go above and beyond and I thought we got terrific value for our money. (You can maximize the value if you prepay. It's non-refundable, but if you have firm travel plans, saving some more money while still enjoying all the benefits of this hotel is a great thing!)

Reviews.Title: “Comfy home away from home...specially for young kids.”
Reviews.Author: Rhodes22
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 4 nights in a 1 BR suite with a King Bed in the room and a pull-out in the Living Room...with 3 kids (ages 9, 5 and 2),...we chose this hotel because it offers much more room than a regular hotel room...2 tvs, free internet access, kitchen amenities just like home (plates, glasses, utensils, cooking pans, microwave, fridge, even granite counters!)...everything one needs for early birds (hotel mini-store even sells 1/2 gallon milk jugs, juices), and midnight snackers...breakfast ready at 630/7 am...and afternoon snacks/light dinner to welcome us after a day of touring. (There are coin-op laundry machines too, if needed.) Good value overall, also a newer hotel...there were lots of families with kids while we were there! Since this is located in the midst of condo developments and business offices area, there are no shopping places/restaurants within walking distance, except a new Bistro at the hotel beside this one (we didn't get to try it, but it seemed promising)...one needs a vehicle from here to anywhere else in SD.

Reviews.Title: “wow~~ what a value”
Reviews.Author: Erica A
Reviews.Content: My family of fice had:: 2 bedrooms a living room with pullout a kitchen 2 bathrooms 3 TV's and as if that wasnt enough Free breakfast and dinner all for $329 a night. I truly couldnt believe it the room was spotless, the food was great & there was a cute pool and hot tub Close to all amusements in San Diego and beutiful views Top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach”
Reviews.Author: timmaple
Reviews.Content: Had a great time at the Homewood - went out to do some fishing off the beach. Was there with my sisters cousin, who is only 13. He just wanted to throw rocks. Man does that kid have an arm. Tim Maple, Kansas City

Reviews.Title: “The dream lives on!”
Reviews.Author: Badputtr
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on great reviews. They were right on. Clean, newer (no flatscreens though), good service, and decent breakfasts. The location is actually very good. (It's the burbs, but good burbs.) We were tourists seeing the zoo, Seaworld, Pacific Beach and were brief freeway drives from each. One pointer- they should stock Cascade for the dishwasher in the room. They had a limited supply in their little store/pantry. Soft towels, responsive housekeeping, good shower pressure, and good heat/AC control are my minimum requirements that aren't met often as I'm a road warrior. This hotel met them all with flying colors.

Reviews.Title: “Andrew Rocks”
Reviews.Author: tmgore34
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time staying at this hotel. It is a bit outside of San Diego, like 15-20 minutes but very easy to find. Andrew is one of the front desk employees and was so incredibly helpful from tips for getting great food, awesome shopping, and directions to everything we need. One morning I had not done my dishes from some food I had cooked but we ran down for breakfast real quick. When we came back our room was already made up and the dishes were done for us. I couldn't believe it. The beds are sooo comfortable and the staff...I mean every single staff member there...was great. I have never had an experience where everyone was so friendly, helpful and great.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service and outstanding value”
Reviews.Author: Newlywed_9
Reviews.Content: We used this hotel for all our extended family and close friends for our wedding. The staff is AMAZING and made it feel like a home away from home. The free dinners with beer and wine (Monday-Thursday) and the daily full breakfast made this an unbelievable value. The beds were extremely comfortable and the two bedroom/two bathroom is hard to find at most hotels. I was able to do laundry on-site and the small store was very convenient. Additionally, the ability to manage the group reservations online and provide guests with a personalized webpage to make their reservations proved to be invaluable. I can't imagine sending my loved ones anywhere else. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “The Reviews are Not Wrong...”
Reviews.Author: Cycleboy
Reviews.Content: Ended up the Homewood Suites when my requested room type was not available at the Hilton Garden Inn right next door. They offered me a room at the Homewood Suites at the same rate and even carried my bags over... (points for Hilton Garden Inn!!) The room was very spacious and well appointed... one little minor thing about the room. The way it was set up the TV was in the center and you couldn't turn it to either face the bed or the couch except at an angle.... weird... other than that it was great... a full kitchen with free microwave popcorn... The staff was great... I was in from the East coast and so was up at the ungodly hour of 4 AM and the night person had fresh (free) coffee in the breakfast area. I didn't do the free breakfast but it looked and smelled good... hot foods (eggs, bacon, waffle maker). There was a little problem on checkout when I noticed on my bill that they had not credited my prepaid room at the Hilton Garden.... but they took care of it right away and were very apologetic....

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a family”
Reviews.Author: kaylor02
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Homewood Suites Dec. 26 - 31. We were originally booked at another "suite" hotel but were sorely disappointed in those accommodations and called Homewood Suites to see if they had rooms available. Much to our relief we were able to check in at any time. We couldn't have been happier with our decision to move. The hotel is located in a quiet area with easy access to the freeway. Our room was very clean and well maintained - the bed was the comfortable hotel bed we have ever slept in. From the complimentary morning breakfasts to the manager's evening receptions we were extemely statisfied with the hotel. The breakfast area filled up with guests each morning but staff members were quick to open up an additional seating area. A staff dedicated to the dining area kept the buffet clean and the food fresh. Although it was too cool to take advantage of the pool, the grounds surrounding the pool were beautiful. There was a small workout room with only three pieces of equipment and free weights. Our only recommendation would be an upgrade to the workout room. We would definately stay at this hotel again and will be recommending it to our friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Price Was Right!”
Reviews.Author: 1570Green
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place that was centrally located for our trip (near La Jolla and Legoland) and the Homewood suites was a perfect fit. The rooms were nicely laid out and clean. My girl friends son gave the waffle maker (breakfast) and popcorn in the room a big thumbs up. The Homestead is located in a new business park and you will need to drive if you want to go out to dinner. We went to Tony's Jacal (Mexican) in Solana Beach - it was great!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place”
Reviews.Author: SussexAdventurers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Homewood Suites recently for 2 nights with my wife and 15 year old son. Our suite was on the top floor (HHonours guests are allocated top floor rooms) . We had no problem with noise. In fact it was extremely quiet. The suite was really spacious and spotlessly clean with decent enough furnishings. We had a full kitchenette including hob, fridge/freezer and even a dishwasher! The complementary breakfast was OK, but nothing special. We didn't use the pool, but it is pretty small and enclosed so wouldn't get much sunshine. Service was very good. Location-wise it is a drive to get to anywhere (there is nothing in the local vicinity) but it is only a short drive to Torrey Pines or La Jolla (beautiful). Downtown San Diego is about 20 mins drive.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel - Great Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Phil2408
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 stayed for 3 nights in a one bedroon suite. The suite was very comfortable and a good size with a well equipped kitchen (including dishwaser - fantastic!). Our only minor issue is that only 2 dining chairs are supplied as standard. The hotel is very clean and the pool is nice. As previous reviewers are commented, the staff are very helpful. The highlight for us was the fantasic breakfast - a very good selection, including hot dishes, served on real plates with real cutlery. There is a supermarket a few minutes drive away, and it is an easy half-hour drive into San Diego. If you are visiting San Diego and don't want to stay in the city, this hotel is ideal. Very highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Felt like home”
Reviews.Author: blondie63
Reviews.Content: We travelled with our 2 young sons to San Diego from Washington D.C. to do some sightseeing and enjoy the So. California beaches. None of us had ever been to California before nor do we know anyone there, so I was flying by the seat of my pants when I selected this hotel (chose mostly for the good reviews on tripadvisor). I was not disappointed. The front desk staff was so friendly and accomodating. The room itself was huge, and the beds were like sleeping on a cloud every night. The huge breakfasts every morning were delicious. We only got to take advantage of the complimentary dinner one night - it was the night they did the outdoor cookout - and it was far beyond our expectations. We haven't stopped tallking about how much we enjoyed this hotel yet - we liked it so much we've already booked to go back next year! San Diego is our new favorite place to visit and we would't dream of staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff made this hotel stay perfect.”
Reviews.Author: scottnleigh
Reviews.Content: We could not rate the hotel staff more highly. After arriving 5 hours early for check in, the front desk staff were more than happy to at least take our bags so we could go visit the beach and get something to eat. When we returned it was again early but they remember us and had a room ready to go. The breakfast included was of excellent standard and catered for our whole family (6,8,13 year olds and 2 adults) to perfection. To our surprise dinner was included during the week which was also up to the breakfast standard. Any questions we had of the staff were answered genuinely which was greatly appreciated by my family of tired travelers. We came to Del Mar to relax and this hotel is the perfect place to do so. Rooms and amenities are clean and the pool was ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: zimbi16
Reviews.Content: This hotel is about 20 minutes north of San Diego. The rooms and public areas of the hotel are well maintained and very clean. There is a patio area with swimming pool and lovely landscaping. The rooms have granite kitchens with full size refrigerator, microwave, dishwasher. Dishes and coffee maker are also included. A hot breakfast is included in the room rate. On Mon. through Thurs. dinner with wine and beer is also included. We had enchiladas one night and there was a cookout the next night. The food was very good and after busy days of sightseeing it was wonderful to just kick back and relax at the hotel. The staff at the front desk were very friendly and helpful. Parking is free and plentiful. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: TamikoBold
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel for business travelers and families alike. Our family stays here any time my husband's work brings him to San Diego, and we absolutely love it. For starters, the staff is absolutely terrific. Everyone, from the front desk staff to the restaurant staff to the maintenance team, is friendly, helpful and courteous. It is so pleasant to stay at a hotel where you know that you'll be treated wtih respect, and welcomed with a smile, regardless of what your question or concern is. The amenities are fabulous as well. The rooms are true "suites," with fully stocked kitchens and living areas separate from the bedroom area. You can actually cook full meals in the kitchen, although you won't have to Monday thru Thursday nights. On those nights, the hotel offers what they call a "light meal." The last time we were there, their idea of a "light meal" was lasagna one night, chicken breasts in mushroom sauce with mashed potatoes the next night, and then their signature BBQ on the patio (complete with burgers, hot dogs and chicken breasts) on Thursday night. Light? I think not! With the meal they offer complimentary beer, wine and kid-friendly drinks like lemonade, so everything (and everyone) is covered. They also have a full breakfast served every day of the week. This is not a continental breakfast (although you can get cereal or bagels if you'd like). They usually have two egg dishes and either bacon, ham or sausage, with potatoes of some sort (on the days they don't have biscuits and gravy!). If you consider the price of feeding a family of 4 both breakfast and dinner, and take that off the price of the room, you'll rapidly figure out that this hotel is a real deal. The rooms are clean and well maintained. The pool, although on the small side, is always stocked with towels and is more than adequate for the size of the hotel. There is a Hilton Garden Inn next door that is affiliated with the Homewood, and they have an absolutely fantastic restaurant, for those nights the Homewood is not serving their "light meal." The location of the hotel is ideal. Even though it appears to be off the beaten path a bit (it's in more of a residential area, which actually makes it very quiet since it's away from the highway), it's actually very close to the beach, Torrey Pines, Legoland, and it's only a 20 minute drive to downtown and Sea World. We love this hotel, and stay there every time we're in San Diego. The staff absolutely makes the place. You won't find a friendlier bunch of people anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place for families”
Reviews.Author: dbtraveler123
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very spacious, the beds were comfortable except for the hide-a-bed (but which ones are). The rooms are very clean! I am very picky about cleanliness. The service is great. The breakfast and dinners are provided at no extra cost and that is a great money saver for families. The food is pretty good considering it is "free". I would highly recommend Homewood Suites Del Mar!!

Reviews.Title: “Gem in Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: AussieGuys
Reviews.Content: We had a week at this property - not really knowing much about the Homewood "concept". What a pleasant surprise. All the staff were delightful - particularly the happy smiling girls at breakfast and the evening "meal". The food was a really good standard, always fresh, always plentiful. The area for us was perfect as we spent a week on Blacks Beach getting the perfect tan. The other bonus here is the 24 hour coffee availability. The suite itself while a little basic perhaps was more than adequate. The standard of cleaning was impeccable. Good use of space too. Well suited to families - with a small pool. Would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED HOMEWOOD SUITES!”
Reviews.Author: daydreamer500
Reviews.Content: Homewood Suites are amazing! The staff went above and beyond to fill every request and answer every question. The complementary morning breakfast was more than enough. My children made waffles and my husband and I enjoyed eggs, potatoes, bagels, juice, hot tea and coffee. Torrey Pines State Beach was just a few minutes away (they have some amazing hiking trails with an ocean view). They had Boogy Boards and Umbrellas for the guest to rent. It was close to all the San Diego Attractions. They even provided a detailed map to all attractions, restaurants, shopping, etc. At night we would sit out by the pool and have coffee and watch the children swim. The rooms were incredibly clean and had all that we needed. My parents, who are no longer able to drive, took the train into Del Mar (the station that was 15 minutes from the hotel). We can't wait to go back next year; only we will be sure to add a few more days. Great Location, Great Price, Great Service, Great Rooms, can't ask for more!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: fhansen
Reviews.Content: We arrived 4 hours prior to normal check-in after a 16 hour less than ideal ride on Amtrak, 4 adults, 2 cranky teenagers, and a grumpy 5 year old. The front desk agent (sorry, I can't remember her name, I think it was Amanda. Her name tag said Tucson,AZ under her name) was so genuinly nice and helpful. She arranged for us to use an unoccupied room so we could shower and change, and get started on our vacation. She definetely started our day out on the perfect note. When we came downstairs my parents room was ready and they were given an early check-in. The rooms were beautiful and spacious, the breakfast buffet was great and pleased 7 different appetites (we were never in the hotel for the evening meal) and every single staff member we encountered was an absolute delight. The housekeepers smiled and greeted everyone who passed and even the young man vacuuming the hall, considerately stopped the vacuume as we passed. The location is off the beaten path, quiet and yet so extremely convenient to Legoland, Sea World, the Zoo, etc. Thank you so much for helping make our San Diego vacation a very special one. Fran Rio Rancho, NM

Reviews.Title: “Feelin At Home At The Homewood Suites!!”
Reviews.Author: ActionJax
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. It was amazingly clean, feels brand new, rooms are comfy, spacious and staff was incredible. The front desk staff was helpful and super friendly. (remembered our names, asked how our trip/day was, and smiled smiled smiled! :) we couldn't believe how incredible the breakfast staff was as well and how attentive they were too. They made special effort to make sure everything was fresh and even made time to walk around and check on us to make sure we were enjoying our meal/stay. Dishes were promptly removed from tables - making room for everyone. Nice selection for breakfast too! (kids made their own waffles and french toast fun fun!!) Price was very affordable, location was near the freeway (but down a few blocks so no traffic noise). We normally enjoy five star resorts - for this economic trip, we were pleasantly surprised! Thanks so much - we will find a reason to come back soon :) (we wanted to remember the girls names at the front desk...wrote them down and dont have them at work - sorry! But they worked all weekend this past week and were a++++++) also, the head bev and food (think his name was amid??) Was incredible too!! Thanks homewood suites!

Reviews.Title: “We've now converted from Embassy to Homewood!”
Reviews.Author: tigerl
Reviews.Content: As Hilton Honors Silver Members, we are loyal to Embassy Suites and have always stayed there, primarily for the two room suites and free hot breakfast. but recently tried a Homewood and we're glad we did. We have a stay at least once every few months. We live only 30 minutes away from this hotel but were visiting the Del Mar fair nearby so decided to stay. The rooms are nice, although the bedroom could have been more spacious. The king bed is a "small" king, it seems short to me? I miss the option for the 2 queens that Embassy Suites usually has. The flatscreen TVs (2) are *very* nice. The room itself was clean and the full kitchen well stocked and everything clean. The breakfast while not quite up to par with Embassy Suites (no made to order omelet bar) was nearly as good, several hot items although in my opinion they need a better hot tea bag selection for us who like tea. The dinner on the patio was what really sold me on this hotel. We stayed a Thursday night and dinner for my family of five included BBQ chicken breasts, beans, hamburgers and hotdogs, potato salad, fresh green salads, potato chips, lemonade, wine, beer, iced tea - all we wanted - plus all the condiments - completely free. I figure with free breakfast and free dinner for my family of five who are all hearty eaters I saved $100. My only complaint - we had left in a hurry and I needed a toothbrush. I was told I could *buy* one at the shop in the hotel. I was disappointed to hear this as even budget hotels give out complimentary toothbrushes. However, when I was grumbling about this on the way to the elevator, a nice woman who worked there offered to bring one to my suite, which she did. Thanks Luz!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Amenities, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: shogan82
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel May 24-31st 2008. Upon arrival we were treated very nice, and check in was quick and easy. I had rented a stroller from a local business San Diego Travel Baby (which I recommend) the front desk had the stroller waiting for me! We stayed in room 126 which is on the first floor. We had a 1 bedroom room and it was plenty of room for my husband our 3 year old son and myself. There was even a gift bag on the kitchen table that had snacks, bottled water, and a welcome note from staff. The kitchen was stocked with plenty of supplies, and was clean and efficient. The living room had a sleeper sofa which is where out son slept. The sleeper sofa was not bad, and worked for a small child. The bedroom was clean and had high ceilings, even a ceiling fan! The bedding was nice and there were several pillows on the bed. The sink is open to the bedroom, and the bathroom was clean and well stocked. The pool is heated, while it is not very warm it was nice and we spent as much time as we could at night in the pool. The hot tub is clean and soothing after a long day walking at the various attractions in the area. The best thing about this hotel, and one of the reasons we decided to stay there was the continental dinner. Monday we had Pot roast, mixed veggies, salad. Tuesday Turkey, mixed veggies, salad. Wednesday Deli sandwiches, soup, and salad. Thursday BBQ w/ hot dogs burgers and chicken, baked beans, and salad. And every night there is beer from a tap, wine, and various other drinks. The breakfast is also very good with a wide range of items including waffles, cereals, oatmeal, fruits, hot food like eggs, sausage, bacon, hash, and many other things as well. The negative about this hotel is the location; it is a bit of a drive to restaurants, shopping and attractions. But even though the location is far it is easy to find and you can get anywhere in about 10 minutes. Upon check out I noticed that we had been charged for a movie rental, I think my son might have hit a button on the remote and ordered a movie. The front desk was very helpful and stated that they would remove the charge. Another thing to note is the front office has a list of various business/restaurants near by that includes directions (be sure to ask for this list as it was very helpful for us)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: Treeless
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights over Memorial Day weekend. We stayed on the 4th floor and it was quiet. A breakfast buffet was included with the price. The hotel was probably full because the breakfast room was crowded every day when we were there. Lots of families with kids. The staff kept bringing out more food so nobody was waiting. Each day we had scrambled eggs, sausage & fried potatoes on Sat., corned beef hash on Sun. and bacon & fried potatoes on Mon. They also had waffles, bagels, toast, muffins, cereal, juice, fresh fruit, oatmeal, & yogurt. The room was clean and cleaned every day. The thermostat easily adjustable with a continuously running fan if you want. (We do.) The staff was pleasant and helpful. The parking was free. It is in a corporate area so there is only one restaurant next door at the Hilton. You have to drive a ways to the mall for other restuarants. But overall it was a very good experience!

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay”
Reviews.Author: nlg
Reviews.Content: We recently spent two nights at the Homewood Suites Del Mar. The hotel was in a great location for us. We arrived about lunch time and were able to check in. We went next door to the Hilton Garden Inn for lunch(very good) and then we went to the Torrey Pines beach nearby-a very nice beach for a walk. This hotel is in a nice residential area-we woke up early(still on Central Time) and went for a walk around the hotel-we found a nice park area nearby with a walking trail. The hotel has free internet access-a plus when you bring your laptop. The breakfast was very good and had different items each morning and the afternoon dinner and drinks(wine, beer, lemonade and tea) was very nice. We ate a nice lunch out both days and enjoyed just being able to have free dinner at the hotel. The dinner also included salad-which was very good and fresh. The pool area was also very nice. If you have a family or just a couple I think you will enjoy this hotel. We left after two nights to drive up the coast and this hotel is out of downtown San Diego so you are already in the direction you go to head to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: idealist
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here with our 17 month old and loved this hotel because it was perfect for travel with a small child. There was plenty of space in the king size bed room for a playpen and it was great to be able to close the bedroom door (like at home) to give me and the hubby some alone time in the living room to watch movies or TV. It was also great to have a hot complimentary breakfast first thing in the morning, because as all other parents of a young child know, they want to eat right away when they wake up! They had pretty healthy options for kids like plenty of fresh fruit, cereal, scrambled eggs and bread. The hotel staff was very courteous and especially helpful in the breakfast rush (even helped tug a high chair in my direction), they were very eager to help and make sure breakfast ran smoothly for all. Also, it was great to have a kitchenette in the hotel room that you could use to cook something quick (if you have a picky eater) or store milk/formula if needed (has a refridgerator, microwave, dishwasher, and stocked cabinets with plates, silverware). This hotel was a little out of the way of the main attractions in San Diego (about 15 minutes away), but it was in a very safe, quiet area away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Strongly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeandAnn
Reviews.Content: A relatively new Hotel which offers all of the usual Hilton benefits so there are no surprises when you check in.Next door is a Hilton Garden which at the time of our stay was yet to open.The location was both good and bad. It was located in a business park area so at all times you needed to travel to find restaurants and shops. For the first few days , we never got back to the hotel the same way twice.But on the plus side ,it was not too far to San Diego by car or train and it was quiet at night. In all , a nice clean hotel with a pool and plenty of free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Beware rude owner!”
Reviews.Author: roedscom
