Reviews.Content: We travel often and were excited about trying Homewood Suites in Del Mar. The front desk made a mistake with our reservation and replaced our room with a more expensive room. The fridge had old food in it, there were dead flies in two of the glasses in the cupboard and blood on the comforter. There were several other issues as well. We spoke to staff about our concerns that night and the following day. We asked them to comp one of our three nights. We were told it wouldn't be a problem and that they would get back to us immediately if it was. Upon check-out two days later, we were told that they would not comp us a room and we would need to speak to the general manager, Anne Marie. The front desk staff told us she would call us immediately upon her return. A week and several messages later, she still had not called. We were eventually able to reach the owner of the property, Bob R.. We explained the situation and he told us he would call us back. He called 90 seconds later and stated, "after meeting with all the staff involved, I have determined you did not give us enough notice (48 hours) to remedy the situation and the decision stands. I am the owner of the hotel and that is my decision. Clearly, he had no intention of refunding the money that his staff had committed to refund. But, that a business owner would not only lie to a customer (re: meeting with staff members) but would engage in rude, discourteous behavior leads me to write my first review encouraging potential guests to think twice about staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a family vacation!”
Reviews.Author: Travel2Explore
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Homewood Suites San Diego-Del Mar over Spring Break with my husband and two young daughters - 5 & 3. The one-bedroom suite was great for the four of us. The suite had a two queen beds in the bedroom which were very comfortable. The bedroom and the living area were separated by a door - great for putting the kids to bed early. The kitchen area was slightly cramped and the table only had two chairs - which was a little inconvenient for the four of us but we worked around it. There was a full refrigerator in the kitchen along with a stove and sink. There was also a full tub in the bathroom - great for the kids. The bathroom was separated with the shower & toilet closed off and the vanity open to the bedroom area. This was slightly inconvenient if you needed to use the vanity sink after the kids were already asleep. The location of the hotel was good. It was north of the city and very convenient to I-5. Only about 20 minutes from the airport. It was slightly tucked away in a residential area but once we figured out how to get there, it worked out fine. And parking was free - bonus! The free breakfast in the morning was wonderful. Lots of choices - waffles, eggs, bagels, cereal, fresh fruit, etc. We tried the free dinner one night and it was good as well - simple with a very specific meal served each night. Worked well for the kids after a long day out & about. The pool was small but adequate - although unfortunately it wasn't warm enough to swim for very long while we were there. The hot tub was very nice. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel for families needing a home base for an active vacation who aren't planning on just hanging out at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Annie071
Reviews.Content: We had a nice stay at this hotel. Rooms were clean, beds comfortable and staff top notch! And, the free breakfast was nice too! Great if you're traveling with kids because of the kitchen and suite set-up! I'll look for Homewood Suites the next time I travel!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay in Del Mar”
Reviews.Author: MariettaGA
Reviews.Content: Very lovely business/tourist hotel located in a business park enviornment. Not close to activities but in a quiet location with occasional noise from the nearby Naval Air Station. Excellent breakfast and light supper each day. Extremely helpful staff. Very responsive to requests and issues. Clean comfortable beds and rooms. We were happy with the general property.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Homewood Suites!”
Reviews.Author: kwick58
Reviews.Content: My husband and I along with another couple just spent 5 great nights at the Homewood Suites. Our suite had 2 large bedrooms, each with a king size bed, private bathroom and TV. The bathroom was huge with granite counter tops. The bed, the pillows, the down comforter was luxurious and comfy. It was the best sleep I have ever had away from home! There was a small but comfortable living area btwn the 2 bedrooms with yet another TV. The kitchen was well stocked with fridge, microwave, dishwasher and small table and chairs. The courtyard was small but beautiful. Lucious tropical foilage, flowers in bloom, surrounded the pool and hot tub. There was several stainless steel gas grills and lots of patio furniture. They also had several heaters which allowed you to sit outside even on a cool night. Every morning breakfast was served in the dining area. The menu varied each day. Several types of egg dishes, waffles, potates, bacon, sausage, a variety of breads and pastries, hot and cold cereals, fresh fruit salad, yogurt... Everything was good and a real value since it was included in the price of the room. On Monday thru Thursday, a light supper was also served. Nothing special but a real convenience if you had been out sight seeing all day, to come back to a prepared meal. One night was vegetable lasagna (Stouffers), salad, garlic bread. Several types of wine and canned beer was also avaiable at no extra charge! The day we left, they were preparing for a "grill out night " in the courtyard for supper. The hotel has a computer room with 2 computer stations and a printer which was convenient for printing out boarding passes. There was also a small fittness room. The staff was very friendly and helpful. It seems they have thought of everything to make your stay as comfortable as possible. The hotel itself is nestled between up-scale condo complexes and office builings right off Hgwy 5. It's a great location for traveling around the city. We had a great stay and would deffinately come back!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: MHS62
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights in November 2007, there were 7 of us. The rooms were clean, I've never seen such clean rooms. The front desk employees were not unfriendly, however the man watching over the dining room for meals was not friendly at all. The food was ok, mediocre at best, but free, which is a good deal for families. All that said, I would stay here again because of the cleanliness of the hotel. That was exceptional!! I can skip the free meals as there are several places to eat close to the hotel. One of which is the Original Pancake House in San Diego - wonderful breakfast!

Reviews.Title: “Had all we needed”
Reviews.Author: CFM41
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 stayed here for 3 nights in October. We were pleased with everything from the cleanliness of the rooms to the good breakfasts. We even ate one evening meal to avoid the extra cost and found it adequate for the evening. We were pleased with the amount of food for our three teenagers. I had read the reviews about the noise and was a bit concerned about it. On the second night it seemed that the room next door was having a party. It was starting to get very loud from that direction. However, by 10:30pm the noise level came down and we were able to sleep very well. I would recommend this hotel for families. We left the day the fires began so I hope that all is ok. We would return again for the breakfasts, cleanliness, pool area, and nice location away from the city but easy access to it when we wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've stayed in”
Reviews.Author: alanwigan
Reviews.Content: This is the worst hotel that I have stayed at for service. I have stayed with Hilton worldwide paying 1st class airfares but this is an awful hotel. The hotel has been set up for the benefits of the manager's friends. One one night three of his mates turned up and were given a jug of ale free while they sat back an watched the football. The food was just about edible. I had the misfortune to be evacuated after the San Diego fires. Not only did the manager expect me to pay for the taxi to take me to safety but I was actually charged for the nights accommodation I spent in a shelter (actually under the stars). I am still fighting to get my money back. When I returned to the hotel the staff didn't speak to me, were rude while my room wasn't even serviced. I moved to the Embassy Suites, La Jolla afterwards where the staff could not have been more different. Please don't stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Home Away From Home in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: fedexflyer
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our four day stay at the Homewood Suites San Diego-Del Mar. From the time we arrived to the time we left, we had a nearly perfect stay. Check-in was easy, and since it was dinner time, they gave me a sheet that listed all of the nearby restaurants, including driving directions and a note referencing those that were 'family friendly'. While we ate in restaurants Saturday and Sunday night, Monday through Thursday they provide quite a good dinner, with a rotating menu (such as pizza, chicken Caesar salad, chili with baked potatoes), and complementary wine and locally-brewed Firehouse beer. Breakfast, while not made to order, was quite good, with scrambled eggs, breakfast potatoes, meat of the day (bacon, sausage or ham), make-your-own waffles, cereal and pastries. Our suite was well-maintained, with the typical Homewood amenities including two-burner stovetop, microwave, full-size refrigerator, small dining table, two TVs, tall showerhead. The bedroom also had a ceiling fan, which I appreciated. Unlike a previous reviewer, I had no problem with noise, either from the street or from the neighboring rooms. A squeaking door was quickly dealt with by maintenance. The business center had two free computers with Internet access. The outside pool water was cold, but the hot tub was refreshingly warm. As for the local restaurants, we tried the Italian restaurant next to the nearby Von's (skip it--overpriced, mediocre food). We also tried the locally-based regional chain Rubio's, which is a fast casual Mexican restaurant known for their fish tacos. All of the food we had there was good--and reasonably priced. Overall, I highly recommend this hotel, particularly to families and to business travelers looking for an 'extended stay' facility.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Bortch
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at this hotel for seven days and have nothing but praise to give. The hotel staff were friendly and helpful. The room was comfortable, clean, and very spacious. The breakfast and evening meals were not only good but much more than expected. After reading some reviews I was expecting not much more than an expanded continental breakfast and an afternoon snack. The meals were plentiful and and very delicious. We have two small children and they were well recieved by hotel staff and other guests. Also we had no problems with noise from other rooms. Finally as for location, we heard many issues about this hotel being out of the way, however this could not be further from the truth. If you have a car, access to anywhere in the San Diego area is simple since the I5 is so easy to get on and off. We were never more than 20 minutes away from any place we wanted to be. (ie.. downtown, legoland, seaworld, zoo, shopping, airport etc...) Great Job! We will surly return

Reviews.Title: “Everything wonderful - except for the thin wall”
Reviews.Author: PickyCat
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights in a 2-queen suite here in August 2007, after reading the previous reviews. Everything about this hotel was fantastic, except for the very thin wall, which I believe may be the thinnest among all the hotels I've ever stayed at. The following is the detailed story. First, the previous reviews mentioned it could be difficult to find this hotel for the 1st time. This was true for me. The point is that from Hwy 5, you have to take "Local Bypass", which merges with the ramp to Hwy56, before reaching the Carmel Mountain Road exit. We checked in around 2pm. Our suite is at the corner on 4th (top) floor. Across the hallway is the stairway entrance, making it feel like a small section of private hallway. When we first entered the suite, it was really "wow" - the living room and bedroom are both quite spacious, with new décor. I think this hotel is about 2 years old or so. The small kitchen includes 2-coil range, microwave, full kitchen, dishwasher (no detergent available, though), a small dining table, chairs, etc. It really feels like home. The bathroom is small, with the sink (vanity area) separated. There is a door between the living room and rest of the suite, while there is no door between the vanity area and bedroom. The bedroom is right next to the bedroom of our neighbor (a fatal design, but I think it's unlikely to have the bedroom really at corner, due to bathroom pipe connection). The central A/C system is quiet and nice, and the fan does stop blowing when the set temperature is reached (I encountered a non-stop fan blowing on a bed somewhere else before). The living room has a sofa, desk, TV, while the bedroom also has a TV. There is an ok mountain view. If we opened the window, we could hear the highway/traffic noise, but as long as the window is closed, it's ok. The construction is on the other side of the building, so I didn’t hear anything of it, even in the day time. The hotel is in the middle of some business park and townhouses. It looked safe around here. While it's close to Hwy 5 exit, there is virtually no shop/restaurant around. About 1 mile away, with easy local driving, there is a plaza with the supermarket (Vol's), Subway, a Chinese food pick-up(ok), and an Italian restaurant (didn't try). It's quite convenient to visit Sea World, Zoo, Balboa Park, La Jolla, etc, from here. We never encountered any traffic jam on Hwy 5, as the gridlock is at the Hwy 5 section north of Hwy56 (all day long, around Del Mar). When we came back to the hotel in late afternoon/evening, we did notice big traffic jam on Hwy 5 south, from La Jolla to Sea World, but we never needed to drive south in that time frame. We tried the hotel's free light dinner (Mon-Thur only) on the 1st night. It happened to be the type of the food I don't like at all, such that we didn't dare to try the free dinner for the rest of our stay. They do provide the menu, with different variety for each night, so do check that before you plan for dinner. The free breakfast buffet is pretty good, with the waffle machine, in addition to hot scrambled egg, ham/sausage. Now coming back to the thin wall. In our 1st night of stay, before I went to bed ~ 10:30pm, I heard some argument from a man and a woman in the adjacent room. It didn't sound like yelling, and it appeared the wall between our bedroom and our neighbor’s is pretty thin. When I finally went to bed, the woman started to weep. What a night! To make things worse, our beds are right next to that thin wall, with the headboards right on it, so my head was very close to that thin wall. The episode went on until midnight or so. The 2nd night was better. I could still hear some brief talking. It sounded the unhappy couple had checked out. I could hear when my neighbors took shower, which didn't really bother me. Then the 3rd night, around 2am, we were waken up by the 5-10 minute hacking cough of our neighbor. Worse came worse - at 6am, we were awaken by the music alarm of our room. We never set the alarm and didn't hear the alarm in the previous mornings. Anyway, since we couldn't 100% exclude our 5-year old son as the culprit (he denied it, and we doubted he would know how to set it up), we didn't complain this to the hotel. Anyway, it's a good idea to always double check the alarm is not set, even on the 3rd night of stay. Before I went to bed on the 4th night, I already developed some anxiety for sleeping here – I didn’t know what would happen, and my sleep was in the control of my neighbors. Unfortunately, my neighbors came back after 10pm, and kept talking. They didn’t shout or yell, but the wall is so thin that unless you intentionally lower down the voice, your neighbor will hear you. At around 12am, I got fed up and decided to try the sofa bed in the living room. The sofa bed was not comfortable at all, with a thin mattress and no sheet, plus the refrigerator noise. When I went back to the queen size bed at 1am, finally my neighbors had stopped talking. When I complained this to the hotel staff, they acknowledged the wall is thin. This is a structure problem, and there was nothing they could do. In summary, I think everything about this hotel is wonderful, except for the very thin wall. However, with paying more than $250 per night, one deserves a better sleep, which is the most important thing. I think the wall of this hotel is probably the thinnest among all the hotels I’ve ever stayed in. I don’t recall being bothered by the voice in the next room, other than the TV sound. My advice for the light sleepers is: if you can’t tolerate people talking nearby while you sleep, DO NOT stay in this hotel, unless you want to bet on that your neighbors won’t like to stay up late and talk.

Reviews.Title: “THE place for a family”
Reviews.Author: LVMV
Reviews.Content: This hotel was GREAT for our family of 5!!! We had LOTS of room. It also had a full kitchen including cookware and dishes, stove, big fridge and even a dishwasher. When we were given our room I was a little worried because we had the last room in the hall closest to an area that they were obviously remodeling. I cannot tune out noises and almost expected to hear everything but heard NOTHING!!! We were gone all day every day for 5 days but when we were there at night it was QUIET!! The breakfast was good, eggs, bacon, sausage, waffles, cereal .... They had evening food too but we weren't ever there to enjoy it. The staff was very friendly and had great maps to get to anything you could want to do or eat. We will absolutely stay there again. This is the kind of place you'd still be happy after a MONTH of staying there!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and a nice property”
Reviews.Author: Googin
Reviews.Content: This is a very good choice for families with young kids (and others as well) as it includes almost everything, including light dinner (granted, not all the choices will be to your liking, but still...) Nice, quiet room with full kitchen amenities. It's not very close to anything that a tourist would need - still, it's only a 10 minute drive to whatever you do need, and the surrounding area is nice with office buildings and condos. Very helpful front desk and a general manager who actually mingled with the guests. Since San Diego is so large, with attractions all over the place, this property works well if you want to take advantage of stuff all over the metro area - just note that it's not very close to downtown. Solid choice overall.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Home Base!”
Reviews.Author: alcwHouston
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel. They cover all the bases. Rooms are excellent and spotless. Staff is friendly and professional. The breakfast and weekday dinners are wonderful. It is close to everything you want to see in San Diego. Bravo to Homewood Suites in Del Mar! You made our vacation with our 3 kids less stressful and more fun!

Reviews.Title: “Homewood Suites: A Good Option for Families”
Reviews.Author: AustinTexan
Reviews.Content: My wife and I, and our three children, stayed at the Homewood Suites--Del Mar from July 4, 2007 to July 8, 2007. I booked the room on the Hilton website for $215.10 excluding taxes. On my bill the suite was described as a "Larger Suite 1 King Non smoking." The Homewood Suites was our jump-off point for visits to San Diego area attractions. This is not a destination hotel but rather an option for those who need more room at a moderate price. It is very convenient to the towns and beaches of Del Mar and La Jolla. Since it is at least 20 mintues north of downtown San Diego it is also convenient to the San Diego Wildlife Park. We spent our last night at the Hilton San Diego Airport/Harbor Island and took in many of the downtown area sites at that time. Back to Homewood Suites. This hotel is perfect for families. It is also perfect for those who want to concentrate their visit on La Jolla and Del Mar. The hotel serves a hot breakfast every morning and dinner Monday through Thursday. With five mouths to feed, I found this feature very attractive. Dinner even included cold beer...which I found equally attractive. We enjoyed all of the meals. The staff is excellent and helpful. Speaking of the staff, the front desk gave us free tickets to the nearby San Diego County Fair so as to take in the fair and fireworks. Our room overlooked the front entrance. But you won't be staying here for the view. As other posters have noted, you are in area of quiet office building and very nice apartments/condos. The worst thing about the hotel is learning to navigate your way to the hotel. Getting to the hotel will challenge your compass and pioneering skills. "Carmel Mountain" is a critical road in this process. Yet at one point, the road actually takes a 90 degree turn and becomes Carmel Mountain again. Meanwhile, the roadway you were traveling that was once called Carmel Mountain continues going straight....but assumes a new name. It took awhile but I finally figured it out. This hotel suffered damage during a June 7th fire at an adjoining hotel that was under construction. As a consequence, half of the rooms were being cleaned-up and refurbished. My guess is that all rooms will be back on line by the end of the summer. This did not affect our visit in any way. The pool is perfect for kids. The nearby hot tub was hot and felt great after a long day at the beach or site-seeing. The suite was great...no complaints. In sum, this is a well-managed property and was perfect for my family. My kids had a great time and I left very satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice home base for exploring San Diego”
Reviews.Author: travelerLondonON
Reviews.Content: Our group of 6, including 2 small children, stayed here in two suites (each was a one bedroom/living room/full kitchen/one bathroom suite) June 23-27. We found this hotel to be modern and very clean. The staff was very nice, especially the manager. There was a great complimentary breakfast every morning, free newspaper, free parking, free coffee/tea and some fruit available all day long. The hotel is located very conveniently close to I-5, but it is up the hill from the freeway and there is no noise. There was a fire on a construction site beside the hotel a couple of weeks before our stay. It occurred on appoximately June 12, 2007. The hotel next door that was under construction, and soon to be open, completely burned down. This caused some external damage to one of the wings of the Homewood Suites hotel, and some water damage in the suites of that wing. As a result, the hotel closed that wing for renovations. Otherwise, the hotel is fully operational, including the center courtyard, pool, and hot pool. Other than seeing the external damage to the one wing of the hotel as we drove up, nothing bothered us. The hotel was easy to find when travelling from the SAN airport. I suggest following the directions as outlined on the Homewood Suites website: Heading I-5 North - Take local bypass for state highway 56. This is 100 yards past the Sorrento Valley Road exit. Exit Carmel Mountain Road and turn right. Drive one third mile to Vista Sorrento Parkway. Turn right on Vista Sorrento Parkway, drive one half mile to the Pacific Plaza traffic light. Make a U-turn at the traffic light and the hotel will be on your right. These directions are much more accurate than the ones from mapquest. The hotel was a great base for tourists exploring San Diego. An approximately 20 minute drive to San Diego ZOO and Balboa Park, 15 minute drive to Seaworld, 25 minute drive to Coronado, 10 minutes to Del Mar Beach or La Jolla area. Although there are no restaurants next to the hotel, there are restaurants and a Vonns grocery store within a 5 minute drive. Front desk has a very good information sheet with directions. Overall we were very happy with this hotel. It helped us have a great vacation in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Just As Good As a Condo”
Reviews.Author: MomofthreeboysUtah
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at HHS with our 3 boys & it was excellent. We typically stay in condos but we opted for a hotel this time b/c of the great reviews this place had. It was great getting maid service everyday (condos don't do that) & we loved the meals. The breakfasts were great & it was wonderful to come back after a long day & have dinner waiting. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay there.

HotelInfo.Name: Homewood Suites San Diego-Del Mar
HotelInfo.Address: 11025 Vista Sorrento Parkway, San Diego, CA 92130
